expiatio: <entryFree id="n17038" type="main" key="expi^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>expio</etym>, <sense id="n17038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">satisfaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atonement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expiation</hi> (rare but class.): at vero scelerum in homines atque impietatum nulla expiatio est, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 14, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foederis rupti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:29:36 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 29, 36 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
expiator: <entryFree id="n17039" type="main" key="expi^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an atoner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expiator</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">impuritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
expiatorius: <entryFree id="n17040" type="main" key="expi^a_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expĭātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>expiator</etym>, <sense id="n17040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">atoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expiatory</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 21:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 21, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expiatrix: <entryFree id="n17041" type="main" key="expi^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>expiator</etym>, <sense id="n17041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an atoning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">expiating priestess</hi>: piatrix dicebatur sacerdos, quae expiare erat solita, quam quidam ... sagam, alii expiatricem vocant, Fest. s. v. piatrix, p. 213 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
expiatus: <entryFree id="n17042" type="main" key="expi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>expio</etym>, <sense id="n17042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">atonement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expiation</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expictus: <entryFree id="n17043" type="main" key="expictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from expingo.</entryFree>
expilatio: <entryFree id="n17044" type="main" key="expi_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expīlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>expilo</etym>, <sense id="n17044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pillaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plundering</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">expilatio direptioque sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 21, 75</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">expilationes direptionesque sociorum et civium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expilator: <entryFree id="n17045" type="main" key="expi_la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expīlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pillager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunderer</hi>: quem domus hospitem, non expilatorem recepisse videatur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 2, 9</bibl>: expilatores, qui sunt atrociores fures, hoc est <foreign lang="greek">lwpodu/tai</foreign>, in opus publicum dari solent, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 18</bibl> (De effractoribus et expilatoribus), 1, § 1.</sense></entryFree>
expilo: <entryFree id="n17046" type="main" key="expi_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pīlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pillage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunder</hi> (class.; syn.: privo, orbo, compilo, spolio, diripio, populor, vasto, praedor). </sense><sense id="n17046.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si socios spolias, aerarium expilas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:1:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 1, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad expilandos socios diripiendasque provincias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 19, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 64, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thesauros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: rem hereditariam,<pb n="695" /> <cb n="EXPL" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">expilatae hereditatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47</bibl></cit>, tit. 19.—* </sense><sense id="n17046.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumenda sunt nobis ab iis ipsis, a quibus expilati sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expingo: <entryFree id="n17047" type="main" key="expingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pingo</orth>, <itype>pinxi, pictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to paint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depict; to paint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paint over.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17047.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam et pericula expingimus, ne quis miretur et rogos pingi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 7, 31, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genas,</quote> <trans><tr>to paint</tr>, <tr>rouge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:83:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 83, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:52:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 52, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (Thamar),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17047.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">to picture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">describe to the life</hi>: qui motus hominum, qui ferarum non ita expictus est, ut quae ipse non viderit, nos ut videremus, effecerit? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 114</bibl> (see the passage in connection).</sense></entryFree>
expinso: <entryFree id="n17048" type="hapax" key="expinso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pinso</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bruise to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">far,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expio: <entryFree id="n17049" type="main" key="expi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make satisfaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atonement for</hi> a crime or a criminal; <hi rend="ital">to purify</hi> any thing defiled with crime; <hi rend="ital">to atone for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to expiate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purge by sacrifice</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: pio, lustro, placo, paco). </sense><sense id="n17049.1" n="I" level="1"> Relig. t. t. </sense><sense id="n17049.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">SACRVM COMMISSVM QVOD NEQVE EXPIARI POTERIT, IMPIE COMMISSVM ESTO: QVOD EXPIARI POTERIT, PVBLICI SACERDOTES EXPIANTO,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tua scelera di immortales in nostros milites expiaverunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have avenged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 35, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in iis sine illius suffimentis expiati sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 14, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatum patri, ut filium expiaret pecunia publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum lustralibus salivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae violata sunt, expiabuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">expiandum forum Romanum a nefarii sceleris vestigiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 12, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17049.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To avert</hi> an omen or sign, i. e. to prevent the evil indicated by it: <cit><quote lang="la">quae di significent, quemadmodum ea procurentur atque expientur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:63:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 63, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigia quae neque hostiis neque votis piare fas habet gens superstitioni obnoxia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 13 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma nondum expiatis uncta cruoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira detestatio nulla expiatur victima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 90</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17049.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, beyond the relig. sphere. </sense><sense id="n17049.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To atone for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make amends for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make good</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec superioris aetatis exempla expiata Saturnini atque Gracchorum casibus docet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malam potentiam servili supplicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatorum injurias regisque caedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 10, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">incommodum virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cladem victoriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17049.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To appease</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">a me etiam poenas expetistis, quibus conjuratorum manes mortuorum expiaretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutelam navis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oet. 857" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oet. 857</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expiro: <entryFree id="n17050" type="main" key="expi_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expīro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. exspiro.</entryFree>
expiscor: <entryFree id="n17051" type="main" key="expiscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-piscor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n17051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> (lit., to fish out; hence, trop.), <hi rend="ital">to search out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find out</hi> (perh. only vulg.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: rimor, perscrutor, scrutor, indago, investigo, quaero): proinde expiscare, quasi non nosses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescis me ab illo omnia expiscatum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul atque audivit, a philosopho voluptatem tantopere laudari, nihil expiscatus est,</quote> <trans><tr>he asked</tr>, <tr>inquired no further</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 28, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
explanabilis: <entryFree id="n17052" type="hapax" key="expla_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explānābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>explano</etym>, <sense id="n17052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligible</hi>: vox, Sen. de Ira, 1, 3, 5.</sense></entryFree>
explanate: <entryFree id="n17053" type="main" key="expla_na_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explānātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. explano <sense id="n17053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
explanatio: <entryFree id="n17054" type="main" key="expla_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explānātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>explano</etym>. <sense id="n17054.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An explanation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpretation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">somniis, vaticinationibus, oraculis quod erant multa obscura, explanationes adhibitae sunt interpretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 51, 116</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aequitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius cujusque propositionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illustris sententiae suae (with propositio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res arduae explanationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 68, 87, § 190</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17054.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., as a fig. of speech, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 12, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17054.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A distinct articulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pronunciation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes, cum defuere, explanationem omnem adimentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 18, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emendata cum suavitate vocum explanatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum (shortly before: dilucida pronunciatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
explanator: <entryFree id="n17055" type="main" key="expla_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explānātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an explainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpreter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt enim explanatores, ut grammatici poëtarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 51, 116</bibl></cit>: explanator aut interpres ejus legis, Lact. (Cic. ap. Lact.?) 6, 8. <cb n="EXPL" /></sense></entryFree>
explanatorius: <entryFree id="n17056" type="main" key="expla_na_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explānātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>explano</etym>, <sense id="n17056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">explanatory</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
explanatus: <entryFree id="n17057" type="main" key="expla_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explānātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from explano.</entryFree>
explano: <entryFree id="n17058" type="main" key="expla_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-plāno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> * <sense id="n17058.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to flatten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spread out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suberi cortex in denos pedes undique explanatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 13, § 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17058.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">to make plain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to explain</hi> (class.: <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: explico, expono, interpretor): qualis differentia sit honesti et decori, facilius intelligi quam explanari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 27, 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem latentem explicare definiendo, obscuram explanare interpretando, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:152" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 42, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explanare apertiusque dicere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docere et explanare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid conjecturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 24, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem amicum tuum ais fuisse istum, explana mihi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de cujus hominis moribus pauca prius explananda sunt, quam initium narrandi faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta quod flumen, aut ubi fuerit, non satis explanatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17058.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To utter distinctly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ille juravit, expressit, explanavitque verba, quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:64:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 64, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">explānātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">claritas in voce, in lingua etiam explanata vocum impressio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an articulate pronunciation</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: parum explanatis vocibus sermo praeruptus, Sen. de Ira, 1, 1, 4.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-plānāte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">plainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut definire rem cum explanatius, tum etiam uberius (opp. presse et anguste),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:33:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 33, 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
explanto: <entryFree id="n17059" type="main" key="explanto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-planto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pull up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">root out</hi> a plant (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pampinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:14:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 29, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:38 al" default="NO">11, 2, 38 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
explaudo: <entryFree id="n17060" type="main" key="explaudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explaudo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. explodo.</entryFree>
explementum: <entryFree id="n17061" type="main" key="exple_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explēmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>expleo</etym>, <sense id="n17061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which fills up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17061.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of food, <hi rend="ital">a filling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuffing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inanimentis explementum quaerito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cacumina arborum explementum esse ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 110:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 110, 12</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17061.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">a complement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sequitur ... explementum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 2, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
explendesco: <entryFree id="n17062" type="main" key="explendesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explendesco</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, v. exsplendesco.</entryFree>
expleo: <entryFree id="n17063" type="main" key="exple^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-plĕo</orth>, <itype>ēvi, ētum, 2</itype> (archaic form explenunt, for explent, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=80" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 80</bibl>; cf.: solinunt, nequinunt, danunt, for solent, nequeunt, dant; v. do, redeo and soleo <sense id="n17063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.; inf. praes.</hi> explerier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 21</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Contracted form expleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:47:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 47, 205</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 766</bibl>. explessent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:47:7" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 47, 7</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> explesse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:586 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 586 al.</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>PLEO, whence plenus, compleo, suppleo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n17063.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fill up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17063.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossam aggere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 79 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 82, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 3, 24</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">paludem cratibus atque aggere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:58:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 58, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque inferciens verba, quasi rimas expleat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:69:231" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 69, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 21, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatrices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 21, 42, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alopecias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 18, 55, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bovem strictis frondibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to give him his fill</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <trans><tr>to fill</tr>, <tr>cram one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">edim atque ambabus malis expletis vorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut milites contingant inter se atque omnem munitionem expleant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum (cohortes),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to occupy completely</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 45, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explevi totas ceras quattuor,</quote> <trans><tr>have filled</tr>, <tr>written full</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum bonis omnibus explere mundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expleti (voce) oris janua raditur,</quote> <trans><tr>filled up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 532</bibl></cit>, v. Lachm. ad h. l.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 10, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 545</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">centurias,</quote> <trans><tr>to have the full number of votes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:47:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 47, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:64:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 64, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justam muri altitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">His rebus celeriter id, quod Avarici deperierat, expletur,</quote> <trans><tr>is filled up</tr>, <tr>made good</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 31, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 22, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic explevit, quod utrique defuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 42, 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17063.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17063.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to fill up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id autem ejusmodi est, ut additum ad virtutem auctoritatem videatur habiturum et expleturum cumulate vitam beatam,</quote> <trans><tr>make quite complete</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">damnationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem relictam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:7:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: damna, Liv. <cb n="EXPL" /> 3, 68, 3; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 30, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">explet concluditque sententias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:69:230" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 69, 230</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias mollioribus numeris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17063.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17063.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To satisfy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appease</hi> a longing, or one who longs (the fig. being that of filling or stuffing with food): <cit><quote lang="la">quas (litteras Graecas) sic avide arripui quasi diuturnam sitim explere cupiens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunam cupidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:876" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 876</bibl></cit>: libidines (with satiare), Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 424, 30</bibl> (Rep. 6, 1); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">explere cupiditates, satiare odium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 27, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cael. 20, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium factis dictisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 32, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 30, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem exspectationem diuturni desiderii nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:47:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 47, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritiam pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 44, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 75 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim vereor, ne non scribendo te expleam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se caede diu optata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 24, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum regem (divitiis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem muneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 20, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis suos divitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum suum (amore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum gaudio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corda tuendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 265</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">expleri mentem nequit ardescitque tuendo Phoenissa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 713</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expletur lacrimis dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: alicujus crudelitatem sanguine, Crassus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 52, 225</bibl>.— And <hi rend="ital">reflex.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eorum agris expleti atque saturati cum hoc cumulo quaestus decederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem alicujus rei (cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 463, and v. impleo): animumque explesse juvabit ultricis flammae,</quote> <trans><tr>to have sated the mind with the fire of revenge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 586</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17063.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To fulfil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi> a duty: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">susceptum rei publicae munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusatione officium scribendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17063.8" n="c" level="4"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring to a close</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum signis omnibus ad idem principium stellisque revocatis, expletum annum habeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatales annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:53" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam in Aetolia ducentos annos explere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explebat annum trigesimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 48</bibl></cit>.* </sense><sense id="n17063.9" n="II" level="1"> (<hi rend="ital">Ex</hi> in privative signif.; v. ex, III. A.). <hi rend="ital">To unload</hi>: navibus explebant sese terrasque replebant, i. e. <hi rend="ital">disembarked</hi>, exonerabant se, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 545</bibl> (Ann. v. 310 ed. Vahl.).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-plētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod undique perfectum expletumque sit omnibus suis numeris ac partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:13:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique expleta et perfecta forma honestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:15:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae natura desiderat, expleta cumulataque habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expletum omnibus suis partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita animi corporisque expleta virtutibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expleta rerum comprehensio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 21</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum expleta desiderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:116" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expletio: <entryFree id="n17064" type="hapax" key="exple_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explētĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>expleo, I. B. 2. a.</etym>, <sense id="n17064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a satisfying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ea expletione naturae summi boni finem consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expletivus: <entryFree id="n17065" type="main" key="exple_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explētīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>expleo</etym>, <sense id="n17065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving to fill out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expletive;</hi> in the later grammarians, conjunctiones, such as <hi rend="ital">quidem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equidem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">autem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quoque</hi>, Don. p. 1763 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 199</bibl> ib. al.</sense></entryFree>
expletor: <entryFree id="n17066" type="main" key="exple_to^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explētŏr</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who fills</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finishes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Pelag. 1, 32 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
expletus: <entryFree id="n17067" type="main" key="exple_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from expleo.</entryFree>
explicabilis: <entryFree id="n17068" type="main" key="expli^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>explico</etym>, <sense id="n17068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be explained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explicable</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">mensura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 28, § 98</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-plĭcābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an explicable manner</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 401</bibl> P.; Mar. Plot. de Metr. p. 2623.</sense></entryFree>
explicanter: <entryFree id="n17069" type="main" key="expli^canter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explĭcanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intelligibly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plainly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Gram. Comm. Art. Don. p. 343:2" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> Gram. Comm. Art. Don. p. 343, 2</bibl> Lindem.</sense></entryFree>
explicate: <entryFree id="n17070" type="main" key="expli^ca_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explĭcātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. explico, <sense id="n17070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
explicatio: <entryFree id="n17071" type="main" key="expli^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>explico</etym>, <sense id="n17071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unfolding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncoiling</hi> (for the most part only in Cic.). * </sense><sense id="n17071.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">est quasi rudentis explicatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:56:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 56, 127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17071.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> <pb n="696" /> <cb n="EXPL" /> of speech, <hi rend="ital">an unfolding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an explication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explanation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum ad ea, quae quaerimus, explicatio tua ista profecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:63:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 63, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicatio fabularum et enodatio nominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:24:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 24, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illustris perpolitaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira in disserendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 38, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
explicator: <entryFree id="n17072" type="main" key="expli^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an expounder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explainer</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum explicator prudens, severus, gravis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
explicatrix: <entryFree id="n17073" type="hapax" key="expli^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explĭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that expounds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">explains</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis perpetuae ad persuadendum accommodatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
explicatus: <entryFree id="n17074" type="main" key="expli^ca_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from explico.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17075" type="main" key="expli^ca_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>explico</etym>, <sense id="n17075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unfolding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stretching apart.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n17075.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterno crurum explicatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 67, § 166</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n17075.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">an explication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(natura deorum) quam difficiles explicatus haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:39:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 39, 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
explicit: <entryFree id="n17076" type="main" key="expli^cit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explĭcit</orth>, v. explico <sense id="n17076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> !*?.</sense></entryFree>
explicitus: <entryFree id="n17077" type="main" key="expli^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explĭcĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from explico.</entryFree>
explico: <entryFree id="n17078" type="main" key="expli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-plĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi and ŭi</itype> (the latter first in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 280</bibl>; afterwards freq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 23, 6</bibl> et saep.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 20</bibl>), ātum or ĭtum (Cic. uses mostly atum, Caes. atum and itum; cf. <sense id="n17078.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">explicaturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:78:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 78, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with explicitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 75, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, explicitius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 78, 2</bibl></cit>; upon these forms v. Neue, Formenl. 2, pp. 479 sq., 550 sq.), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to unfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unroll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfurl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loosen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undo</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. sense; syn.: expedio, extrico, enodo, enucleo; explano, expono, interpretor). </sense><sense id="n17078.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">velum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non explicata veste neque proposito argento, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>spread out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumen,</quote> <trans><tr>to open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suas pennas (ales),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenas plagas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:56:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 56, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perturbatum et confusum agmen,</quote> <trans><tr>to put in order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:14:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum pectine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=129" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 129</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">fusos,</quote> <trans><tr>to unwind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:54:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 54, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem sollicitam,</quote> <trans><tr>to free from wrinkles</tr>, <tr>to smooth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: explicare seria contractae frontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 125</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to calm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 455" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex his te laqueis exueris ac te aliqua via ac ratione explicaris,</quote> <trans><tr>hast extricated</tr>, <tr>freed thyself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:58:section=151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 58, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (ex funibus ancorarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicae et oves, difficile se (apibus) e lanis earum explicantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se explicat angustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:55" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 55</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17078.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deploy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 23, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:5:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 5, 26 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes (longa legio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se turmatim (equites),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 93, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mid.: priusquam plane legiones explicari et consistere possent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26, 4</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ordo omnium navium explicari posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 23, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per obstantis catervas Explicuit sua victor arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atria, congestos satis explicatura clientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:146" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut forum laxaremus et usque ad atrium Libertatis explicaremus,</quote> <trans><tr>extend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unde pons in oppidum pertinens explicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbes (serpens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 720</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes omnes (pampinus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (montes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arida ligna in flammas (ignis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:882" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 882</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to set out richly</tr>, <tr>to furnish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:100:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 100, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicavi meam rem post illa lucro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>amplified</tr>, <tr>enlarged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n17078.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17078.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very seldom): <cit><quote lang="la">explica atque excute intelligentiam tuam, ut videas quae sit, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>display</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 20, 81</bibl></cit>: Siciliam multis undique cinctam periculis explicavit, <hi rend="ital">has set at large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set free</hi> (qs. released from toils, snares), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 11, 30</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum se explicent dicendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: da operam, ut te explices, huc quam primum venias, Pompei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, D. 2.—</sense><sense id="n17078.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17078.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To disentangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjust</hi> any thing complicated or difficult: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcre ego hanc explicatam tibi rem dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="EXPL" /> 20: <cit><quote lang="la">peto a te, ut ejus negotia explices et expedias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem frumentariam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: si Faberius nobis nomen illud explicat, noli quaerere, quanti, <hi rend="ital">settles</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">pays that item</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 29, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Faberianum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 3; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui debitores, quia non possint explicare pecuniam, differant solutionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:78:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 78, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">his explicitis rebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 75, 2</bibl></cit>: subvenire tempestati quavis ratione sapientis est; <cit><quote lang="la">eoque magis, si plus adipiscare re explicatā boni, quam addubitatā mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae per defunctum inchoata sunt, per heredem explicari debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:7:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transii ad elegos: hos quoque feliciter explicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 4, 7</bibl></cit> (cf. under !*?): <cit><quote lang="la">iter commode explicui, excepto quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihilo plus explicet ac si Insanire paret, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>will make no more out of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 270</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17078.7" n="2" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to develop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>: vitam alterius totam explicare, Civ. Div. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:8:27" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> 8, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfice, ut Crassus haec, quae coartavit et peranguste refersit in oratione sua, dilatet nobis atque explicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:de Or. 1:35:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicando excutiendoque verbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Part. Or. 36:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 36, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid expedite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Brut. 67:237" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 67, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid apertissime planissimeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Verr. 2:2:64:section=156" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 64, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid definitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Fin. 3:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera fando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiam diligentissime Graecis litteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summorum oratorum Graecas orationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geometricum quiddam aut physicum aut dialecticum (corresp. to expedire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 59, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non de aegritudine solum, sed de omni animi perturbatione explicabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de scorpionibus et catapultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut explicemus, quae sint materiae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vero auxilia sunt capitis, eo loco explicitum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n17078.8" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">explĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n17078.9" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">spread out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capua planissimo in loco explicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17078.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17078.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Well ordered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in causa facili atque explicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17078.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi explicata solutione non sum discessurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae tuae, quibus nihil potest esse explicatius, nihil perfectius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicatissima responsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 34" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17078.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Assured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec habet explicatam aut exploratam rationem salutis suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">explĭ-cāte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">plainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui distincte, qui explicate, qui abundanter et rebus et verbis dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 53</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicatius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Civ. D. 19, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17078.14" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">explĭ-cĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II. B. 1.), lit., <hi rend="ital">disentangled</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">free from obstacles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his erat angustiis res: sed ex propositis consiliis duobus explicitius videbatur, Ilerdam reverti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:78:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 78, 2</bibl></cit>.!*? <orth extent="full" lang="la">explĭcit</orth>, in late Lat., at the end of a book, is prob. an abbreviation of explicitus (est liber), <hi rend="ital">the book is ended</hi> (acc. to signif. II. B. 1.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">explicitum nobis usque ad sua cornua librum refers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:107:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 107, 1</bibl></cit>: solemus completis opusculis ad distinctionem rei alterius sequentis medium interponere <hi rend="ital">Explicit</hi> aut <hi rend="ital">Feliciter</hi> aut aliquid istius modi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 28, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
explodo: <entryFree id="n17079" type="main" key="explo_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-plōdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ex-plaudo</orth>), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pternokopei=n</foreign>, <sense id="n17079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off by clapping;</hi> orig. a scenic word said of a player, <hi rend="ital">to hiss</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hoot off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explode</hi> him. </sense><sense id="n17079.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">histrio exsibilatur et exploditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 3, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Aesopum explodi video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem e scena non modo sibilis sed etiam convicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam satis est equitem mihi plaudere, ut audax Contemptis aliis explosa Arbuscula (mima) dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 77</bibl></cit>; cf.: pars plaudite ergo, pars offensi explaudite, Aus. Sept. Sap. de Thal. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n17079.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the scenic sphere. </sense><sense id="n17079.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To drive out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi> (rare; not in Cic.): aliquem in Arpinos, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 186, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(alios) in arenam aut litus,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem explaudentibus alis,</quote> <trans><tr>to scare away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, <cb n="EXPL" /> 710.—</sense><sense id="n17079.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disapprove</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">te illud idem, quod tum explosum et ejectum est, nunc retulisse demiror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 31, 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">explosae ejectaeque sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 8, 31</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc genus divinationis vita explosit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 41, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa dixi in ignobilem regem, quibus totus est explosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fictione pristina explosa,</quote> <trans><tr>abolished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:12:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
explorate: <entryFree id="n17080" type="main" key="explo_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explōrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n17080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with certainty</hi>, etc., v. exploro, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exploratio: <entryFree id="n17081" type="main" key="explo_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exploro</etym>, <sense id="n17081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an examination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exploration</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">surculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exploratione occulta fallere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17081.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a spying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
explorator: <entryFree id="n17082" type="main" key="explo_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explōrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a searcher out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examiner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explorer; a prying person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a spy</hi> (not in Cic.) </sense><sense id="n17082.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: rerum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 366, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppositicius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17082.2" n="b" level="4"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">searching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes, Claud. III. Cons. Hon. praef. 11: foci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:51:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 51, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17082.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17082.4" n="A" level="2"> In milit. lang. </sense><sense id="n17082.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A spy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scout</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 3</bibl>; 2, 17, 1 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17082.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skirmishers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5877</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n17082.7" n="B" level="2"> Explorator viae, <hi rend="ital">one who ran before the emperor to clear the way</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exploratorius: <entryFree id="n17083" type="main" key="explo_ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explōrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>explorator, II.</etym>, <sense id="n17083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to searching out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exploratory</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">coronae,</quote> <trans><tr>a reward for scouts or those who sought out and pursued the enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaphae,</quote> <trans><tr>spy-boats</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 5, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exploratus: <entryFree id="n17084" type="main" key="explo_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exploro.</entryFree>
exploro: <entryFree id="n17085" type="main" key="explo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-plōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to search out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek to discover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explore</hi> (class.; in Cic. esp. freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> syn.: speculor, scitor, sciscitor, percontor, quaero, interrogo). </sense><sense id="n17085.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n17085.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">explora rem totam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:17:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 17, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitum Africae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altera (manus) motu caecum iter explorat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 456</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehiculorum onera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebas gustu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis potionisque bonitatem gustu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 66</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad explorandum idoneum locum castris,</quote> <trans><tr>for choosing out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:81:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 81, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias,</quote> <trans><tr>to seek out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 537</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17085.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">explorare, qui homines inhabitarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud se explorare, an expediat sibi consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exploratum est, ubi controversia incipiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17085.4" n="b" level="4"> In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascertained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">known</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exploratum et provisum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam explorata nobis sunt ea, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspecta et explorata perscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 15, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">res non incertis jactatae rumoribus, sed compertae et exploratae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de numero eorum omnia se habere explorata Remi dicebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 31, 5</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">abl. neutr. absol.</hi>: explorato, <hi rend="ital">it being ascertained</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">when he knew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">explorato, jam profectos amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n17085.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17085.6" n="A" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to spy out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reconnoitre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculatoribus in omnes partes dimissis, explorat, quo commodissime itinere vallum transire possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
