G. 5, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 50, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinera egressusque ejus, postremo loca atque tempora cuncta explorat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siciliam adiit, Africam exploravit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occulte explorare loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explorato hostium consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:18:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante explorato et subsidiis positis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:42:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 42, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:43:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 43, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n17085.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To try</hi>, <hi rend="ital">test</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put to the proof</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">et suspensa focis explorat robora fumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus in adversis explorat cornua truncis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 603</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc jugulo dextram explora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:358" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 456</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">explorans quid hostes agerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 28, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec exploranda per impigros juvenes esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundae res animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyranni fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 582</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">explōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">ascertained;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">established</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confirmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ei jam exploratus et domi conditus consulatus videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 24, 49</bibl></cit>: magna et prope explorata<pb n="697" /> <cb n="EXPO" />  spes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae exploratae a timore,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>affording certainty</tr>, <tr>confidence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 17, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo mihi exploratum est, ita esse, ut scribis,</quote> <trans><tr>I am certain</tr>, <tr>convinced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est tam stultus, cui sit exploratum, se ad vesperum esse victurum?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 19, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua (amicitia) nihil fidum, nihil exploratum habeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exploratam habere pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Deus) habet exploratum, fore, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro explorato habebat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilior et exploratior devitatio legionum fore videtur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exploratissima victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:84:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 84, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">explōrātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with certainty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for a certainty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">securely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surely</hi> (for the most part only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec ita sentio, judico, ad te explorate scribo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15</bibl></cit>, b. 3; cf. judicare, Planc. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis explorate perceptum et cognitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exploratius promittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> seems not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
explosio: <entryFree id="n17086" type="hapax" key="explo_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explōsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>explodo</etym>, <sense id="n17086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a driving off by clapping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an exploding</hi>: ludorum explosiones et funerum, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 11, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
explosus: <entryFree id="n17087" type="main" key="explo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">explōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from explodo.</entryFree>
expolio: <entryFree id="n17088" type="main" key="expo^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expŏlĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smooth off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polish.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17088.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac (i. e. herinacei) cute expoliuntur vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 37, 56, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellus arida pumice expolitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes expolitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expolitus paries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. under <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:19:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scabritias unguium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 4, 6, § 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> in mid. force: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam concessavimus poliri, expoliri, pingi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17088.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to polish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elaborate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes (liberos) expoliunt, docent litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionem Plato doctrinis omnibus expolivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir omni vita atque victu excultus atque expolitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:25:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 25, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi te expoliendum limandumque permittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeca doctrina expolitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:11:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox te expolivit hominemque reddidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 10, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil omnibus ex partibus perfectum natura expolivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 18, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eandem rem eodem modo dicere ... id obtundere auditorem est, non rem expolire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 42, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:41:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 41, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17088.3" n="B" level="2"> Com., <hi rend="ital">to polish off</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to ruin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui amat, nequit quin nihili sit atque improbis artibus se expoliat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">expŏlī-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">polished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens expolitior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:39:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 39, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta expolitiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: villae expolitissimae, Scipio Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:20:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 20, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expolitio: <entryFree id="n17089" type="main" key="expo^li_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expŏlītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>expolio</etym>, <sense id="n17089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smoothing off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rubbing up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finishing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17089.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietum, pavimentorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a plastering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes">7</bibl> praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbana,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of a house in the city</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miniacea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17089.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">an adorning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellishing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17089.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in verbis inest quasi materia quaedam: in numero autem expolitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:55:185" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 55, 185</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:40:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 40, 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17089.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., as a fig. of speech, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 42, 54 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
expolitor: <entryFree id="n17090" type="main" key="expo^li_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expŏlītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a polisher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> in Psa. 85, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expolitus: <entryFree id="n17091" type="main" key="expo^li_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expŏlītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from expolio.</entryFree>
expono: <entryFree id="n17092" type="main" key="expo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsŭi, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype> (ante-class. <sense id="n17092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> exposivit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 27</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">sync. expostus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 694</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:197" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 197</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expose</hi> (class.; most freq. in the trop. signif.; cf.: expedio, explano, explico). </sense><sense id="n17092.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17092.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">stravit pelliculis haedinis lectulos et exposuit vasa Samia,</quote> <trans><tr>set out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:16:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 16, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatum in porticibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in publico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 7, 33, § 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 5, 6, § 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbam in sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ictu,</quote> <trans><tr>to put out</tr>, <tr>turn out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17092.3" n="B" level="2"> <cb n="EXPO" /> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17092.4" n="1" level="3"> Of children, <hi rend="ital">to expose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellam ad necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad januam matris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:27 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 27 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17092.5" n="2" level="3"> Naut. t. t. </sense><sense id="n17092.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To set on shore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disembark</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites ex navibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 37, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: socios de puppibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expositis omnibus copiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; 1, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 40, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5:44" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5, 44</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegra mancipia in insulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>; but also with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Africa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 44, 10</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:79:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 79, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in litore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 22, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 53:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 53, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi Themistoclem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eum locum milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus regionibus exercitum exposuisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expositum peregrinis arenis os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quartā vix demum exponimur horā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: advexi frumentum; <cit><quote lang="la">exposui, vendo meum, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>have unloaded</tr>, <tr>unpacked</tr>, <tr>opened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17092.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To throw on the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene exposivit cubito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17092.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To throw overboard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si propter necessitatem adversae tempestatis expositum onus fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17092.9" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Mercant. t. t.</usg>: pecuniam, <hi rend="ital">to offer</hi> a sum to one, <hi rend="ital">place at one's disposal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be ready to pay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Oppio bene curasti, quod ei DCCC. exposuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit> (for which, aperuisti, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 2</bibl>).— </sense><sense id="n17092.10" n="4" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to leave exposed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unprotected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to expose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay open</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 35, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille ad omnes ictus expositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne inermes provinciae barbaris nationibus exponerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum hosti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 19, 21, § 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteris animalibus imbecillitatem hominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 23, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epit. 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 1</bibl>, ext. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">piscibus beluisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exposito solibus loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 5, 6, § 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. absol.</hi>: (iracundi) simplices videntur, quia expositi sunt, Sen. de Ira, 2, 16, 3.</sense><sense id="n17092.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17092.12" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">totam causam, judices, explicemus atque ante oculos expositam consideremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 12, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam alterius in oculis conspectuque omnium exponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina puerilis publice exposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to publish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 227</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">capita exposita nec explicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:44:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 44, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant huic studio maxima exposita praemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemium,</quote> <trans><tr>to set forth</tr>, <tr>propose</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 23, 74</bibl></cit>: vitam suam exponere ad imitandum juventuti, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 104, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum expositum ad imitandum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exposita ad exemplum nostra re publica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opprobrio ad omnium convicia exposito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expositum ad invidiam nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen Dei,</quote> <trans><tr>to prostitute</tr>, <tr>dishonor</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17092.13" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">to set forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expound;</hi> constr. with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or a <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi> as object, or with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coepit rationem hujus operis scientissime Gallus exponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talis coetus, qualem exposui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae adhuc exposui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscura dilucide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem pluribus verbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem breviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata in senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:62:210" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 62, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias ejus disputationis hoc libro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes rhetoricas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:20:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputationem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem de amicitia alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem multitudini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expone igitur primum animos remanere post mortem, tum docebis, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>explain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud eosdem (censores), qui magistratu abierint, edant et exponant, quid in magistratu gesserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:20:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex memoria alicui quid senatus censuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab initio, res quemadmodum gesta sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc de quo modo exposuit Antonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">expone nunc de reprehendendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:12:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 12, 44</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">abl. neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar contione advocata ... exposito, quid iniquitas loci posset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 52, 2</bibl></cit> Oud.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">exposito quod nuntiatum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi gesta bello expositurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 72</bibl></cit>: summum bonum exposuit <cb n="EXPO" /> vacuitatem doloris, i. q. definivit, <hi rend="ital">be defined</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 5, 14</bibl> Madv.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 8, 22</bibl>; and, expositio, ib. § 21.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">expŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, qs. publicly set out; hence, <hi rend="ital">open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accessible.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17092.14" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:24" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">census,</quote> <trans><tr>open to all</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numen (with nulli negatum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 103</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(homo) obvius et expositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pŏsĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the open parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">those exposed to view</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem ejus tantum novi et exposita, quae ostendit etiam transeuntibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 55:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 55, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17092.15" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17092.16" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Accessible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:246" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 246</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17092.17" n="2" level="3"> Of authors, <hi rend="ital">intelligible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lucid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimos quidem, sed tamen eorum candidissimum quemque et maxime expositum velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17092.18" n="3" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vulgar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nihil expositum soleat deducere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 54</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">expŏ-sĭte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">plainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non exposite et aperte ostendere, sed reconditā significatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:2:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exporrectus: <entryFree id="n17093" type="main" key="exporrectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exporrectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exporrigo.</entryFree>
exporrigo: <entryFree id="n17094" type="main" key="exporri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-porrĭgo</orth>, <itype>rexi, rectum, 3</itype> (contr. <sense id="n17094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imper.</hi> exporge, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 53</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n17094.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites in longitudinem, Auct. B. Afr. 78, 4: munitiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura exporrigentia se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 48, 108, § 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (polypi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc orti montes longo se jugo exporrigunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sesamam in sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 23, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illic purpureo latus exporrecta cubili,</quote> <trans><tr>stretched out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 856</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exporrecto labello,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>protruded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:82" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exporge frontem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unwrinkle</tr>, <tr>smooth</tr>, <tr>clear up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 53</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n17094.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">menses et annos et longam seriem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum vires tuas exporrigens da pauperi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 14, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exportatio: <entryFree id="n17095" type="main" key="exporta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exportātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exporto</etym>. * <sense id="n17095.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A carrying out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exportation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum, quibus abundaremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17095.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Banishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deportation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exporto: <entryFree id="n17096" type="main" key="exporto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-porto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convey away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">export</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">per mare e Phoenice Europam (Juppiter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum quotannis ex Italia Hierosolymam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 28, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum argentumque inde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum in fame,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum numerum frumenti, vim mellis, etc., Syracusis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:72:section=176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 72, § 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 10, § 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora luce carentum tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 256</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qui manus attulerit steriles intro ad nos, gravidas foras exportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: Sigambri finibus suis excesserant suaque omnia exportaverant, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">o portentum in ultimas terras exportandum!</quote> <trans><tr>to be sent away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:15:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 15, § 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exposco: <entryFree id="n17097" type="main" key="exposco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-posco</orth>, <itype>pŏposci, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ask earnestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to beg</hi>, <hi rend="ital">request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to entreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implore</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n17097.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: quam (misericordiam) ipse non implorat, ego autem repugnante hoc et imploro et exposco, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 34, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum proelii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19, 4</bibl></cit>; for which, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exposcentibus militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 90 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 5, 14</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pacem deorum exposcentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut acrius exposcerent quae sciebant negaturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam ab diis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: quod deos immortales inter nuncupanda vota expoposci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 5</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iliacos iterum audire labores Exposcit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17097.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., for the usual deposcere, <hi rend="ital">to demand to be delivered up</hi> for punishment, as a prisoner, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad exposcendos eos legati extemplo Lacedaemonem missi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 31, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. of the same, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 33, 2</bibl>, deposcendos): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hannib. 7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hannib. 7, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Messene exposcentibus Achaeis noxios dedidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:50:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 50, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exposite: <entryFree id="n17098" type="main" key="expo^si^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expŏsĭtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n17098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly;</hi> v. expono, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
expositicius: <entryFree id="n17099" type="hapax" key="expo^si^ti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expŏsĭtĭcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>expono, I. B. 1.</etym>, <sense id="n17099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foundling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expositio: <entryFree id="n17100" type="main" key="expo^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expŏsĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>expono</etym>. <sense id="n17100.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An exposing</hi> of an infant (post-class.), Justin. 1, 4, 9; 1, 5, 4.—</sense><sense id="n17100.1" n="II" level="1"> Of speech. </sense><sense id="n17100.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A setting</hi> <pb n="698" /> <cb n="EXPR" /> <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an exhibiting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">showing; a narration</hi>: cursum contentiones magis requirunt; <cit><quote lang="la">expositiones rerum tarditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:212" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 63, 212</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 10, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:2" default="NO">4, 2, 2</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17100.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A definition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explanation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplices summi boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 8, 21</bibl></cit> (cf. exponere, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 22 Madv.; and 5, 5, 14, p. 635).</sense></entryFree>
expositiuncula: <entryFree id="n17101" type="main" key="expo^si^ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expŏsĭtĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>expositio, II.</etym>, <sense id="n17101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brief exposition</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expositor: <entryFree id="n17102" type="main" key="expo^si^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expŏsĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>expono</etym>, <sense id="n17102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an expounder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpreter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">somniorum, Firm. Math. 13, 5: juris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 9, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expositus: <entryFree id="n17103" type="main" key="expo^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from expono.</entryFree>
expostulatio: <entryFree id="n17104" type="main" key="expostu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expostŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>expostulo</etym>, <sense id="n17104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an expostulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complaint</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset expostulatio facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 59, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuerunt nonnulli aculei in C. Caesarem, contumeliae in Gellium, expostulationes cum absente Pompeio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum suas quisque nunc querelas nunc expostulationes inserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expostulatus: <entryFree id="n17105" type="main" key="expostu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expostŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a complaint</hi> (late Lat. for expostulatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 9:13" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expostulo: <entryFree id="n17106" type="main" key="expostu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-postŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n17106.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To demand vehemently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">urgently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">require</hi> (mostly post-Aug. for class. exposco; not in Cic., since in Rosc. Com. 17, 50, the true read. is: et postulare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: peto, exigo, flagito, postulo): aures meae auxilium expostulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ne civilium quidem bellorum victores expostulaverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primas sibi partes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quid expostulabit usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tarda sunt quae in commune expostulantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Armeniam praesidiis vacuam fieri, expostulabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expostulat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus clamoribus expostulatum est, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:75:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 75, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">expostulante consensu populi, pax inita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:77:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 77, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17106.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (cf. exposco, II.), <hi rend="ital">to require to be delivered up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to demand</hi> one for punishment: <cit><quote lang="la">Marium Celsum ad supplicium expostulabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores caedis ad poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17106.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Cum aliquo</hi> (<hi rend="ital">de aliqua re</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>) or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to find fault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expostulate</hi> with one respecting something; <hi rend="ital">to complain</hi> of one (class.; syn.: calumnior, reprehendo, vitupero, increpo, improbo, etc.).—With <hi rend="ital">acc. rei</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> with <hi rend="ital">abl. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenis a te et facilis existimari debeo, qui nihil tecum de his ipsis rebus expostulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illo injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne illum quidem Juventium tecum expostulavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 24, 58</bibl></cit>. —With <case>acc.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">qui putant sibi fieri injuriam ultro, si quam fecere ipsi, expostules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">tum obstetrix expostulavit mecum, parum missum sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed locus esse videtur tecum expostulandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <hi rend="ital">abl. rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna omnia de nostris cupiditatibus et injuriis expostulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:89:section=207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 89, § 207</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quia</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expostulare, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittebat oratores, qui suo nomine expostularent, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non mecum questus es? aut ... iracundius ac vehementius expostulasti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 15, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne expostulent et querantur, se, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecunde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:12:1:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 12, 1, § 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expotus: <entryFree id="n17107" type="main" key="expo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. epotus, under epoto.</entryFree>
expresse: <entryFree id="n17108" type="main" key="expresse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expressē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n17108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with pressure;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">expressly</hi>, etc.; v. exprimo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
expressim: <entryFree id="n17109" type="main" key="expressim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expressim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>expressus, from exprimo</etym>, <sense id="n17109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">expressly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi> (postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:98" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:19" default="NO">49, 1, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expressio: <entryFree id="n17110" type="main" key="expressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expressĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exprimo</etym> (postAug.), <sense id="n17110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pressing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">squeezing out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17110.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17110.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17110.3" n="A" level="2"> In mechanics, <hi rend="ital">a forcing apparatus</hi> to raise water, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 7</bibl>; cf. 2. expressus.—</sense><sense id="n17110.4" n="B" level="2"> In architect., <hi rend="ital">a projection</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a fillet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">listel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> —</sense><sense id="n17110.5" n="C" level="2"> Of lang., <hi rend="ital">vividness</hi>: summā expressione describere, Ambros. de Cain et Abel, 1, 2, 9. <cb n="EXPR" /></sense></entryFree>
expressor: <entryFree id="n17111" type="main" key="expressor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expressor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exprimo</etym>, <sense id="n17111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who presses out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brings forth</hi> (post-class.); <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: veritatis (with integrator),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expressus: <entryFree id="n17112" type="main" key="expressus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exprimo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17113" type="hapax" key="expressus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expressus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exprimo</etym>, <sense id="n17113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forcing apparatus</hi> for raising water, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl>; cf. expressio, II. A.</sense></entryFree>
expretus: <entryFree id="n17114" type="hapax" key="expre_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exprētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>perh. for exspretus, from ex-sperno; acc. to Salmas. for exprettus = expressus</etym>, <sense id="n17114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spurned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pressed out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 42</bibl> dub., v. Ritschl.</sense></entryFree>
exprimo: <entryFree id="n17115" type="main" key="expri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-prĭmo</orth>, <itype>pressi, pressum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>premo</etym>, <sense id="n17115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press</hi> or <hi rend="ital">squeeze out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to force out</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17115.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum ex malobathro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 26, 59, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucum expresso semini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucum flore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 19, 74, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucum radici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 13, 109, § 136</bibl></cit>; cf.: vinum palmis, oleum sesamae (<case>dat.</case>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum amygdalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudorem de corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimulam oculos terendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nubium conflictu ardor expressus se emiserit, id esse fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquorem per densa foramina (cribri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 438</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam in altum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 23, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam in altitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum has (turres) quotidianus agger expresserat,</quote> <trans><tr>had carried up</tr>, <tr>raised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22, 4</bibl></cit> Oud.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17115.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17115.3" n="1" level="3"> With an object denoting that out of which something is pressed or squeezed, <hi rend="ital">to press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squeeze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spongiam ex oleo vel aceto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 24 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam ex vino vel aceto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus madidas exprimit imbre comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spongiae expressae inter duas tabulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 11, 47, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 27, 60, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia rosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 18, 73, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuberculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 11, 12, § 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17115.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To form by pressure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">model</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">express</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in the elder Pliny): (faber) et ungues exprimet et molles imitabitur aere capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus furorem ... verecundiae ruborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 40, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expressa in cera ex anulo imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem hominis gypso e facie ipsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 44, § 153</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">effigiem de signis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optime Herculem Delphis et Alexandrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 66</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis stricta et singulos artus exprimens,</quote> <trans><tr>exhibiting</tr>, <tr>showing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcher aspectu sit athleta, cujus lacertos exercitatio expressit,</quote> <trans><tr>has well developed</tr>, <tr>made muscular</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n17115.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17115.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To squeeze</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elicit</hi>: lex, quam ex natura ipsa arripuimus, hausimus, expressimus, qs. <hi rend="ital">pressed out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitas expressit nomina rerum,</quote> <trans><tr>has imposed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1029" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1029</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ab iis saepius quaereret, neque ullam omnino vocem exprimere posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expressa est Romanis necessitas obsides dandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confessionem concessi maris hosti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 31, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confessionem cruciatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditionem ultimā necessitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia vi expressa et coacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:69:section=165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 69, § 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu si tuis blanditiis a Sicyoniis nummulorum aliquid expresseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risum magis quam gemitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expressi, ut conficere se tabulas negaret,</quote> <trans><tr>have constrained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:47:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 47, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expressit, ut polliceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17115.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (acc. to I. B. 2.), <hi rend="ital">to imitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to portray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">describe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">express</hi>, esp. in words (cf. reddo): <cit><quote lang="la">cum magnitudine animi tum liberalitate vitam patris et consuetudinem expresserit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>imitated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex expressa ad naturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia imitatione ex aliquo expressa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ante oculos ponit, cum exprimit omnia perspicue, ut res prope dicam manu tentari possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 40, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">63: hanc speciem Pasiteles caelavit argento et noster expressit Archias versibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores alicujus oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multas nobis imagines fortissimorum virorum expressas scriptores Graeci et Latini reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Platonis libris omnibus fere Socrates exprimitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: Mithridaticum bellum magnum<cb n="EXPR" />  atque difficile totum ab hoc expressum est, <hi rend="ital">depicted to the life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 9, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Euryalum exprimat infans,</quote> <trans><tr>may resemble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:81" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 81</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">diligenter, quae vis subjecta sit vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:Fin. 2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exprimere non possum, quanto sim gaudio affectus,</quote> <trans><tr>tell</tr>, <tr>express</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis exprimere quid quis sentiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod exprimere dicendo sensa possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores in scriptis exprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Ter. 4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. Ter. 4</bibl></cit>.—Of translating into another language, <hi rend="ital">to render</hi>, <hi rend="ital">translate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo id exprimere Latine potuero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl>: <foreign lang="greek">kata/lhyin</foreign>, verbum e verbo exprimentes comprehensionem dicemus, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 10, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen exprimi verbum e verbo necesse erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum de verbo expressum extulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabellae Latinae ad verbum de Graecis expressae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 18, 1</bibl>.—Of words, <hi rend="ital">to pronounce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo exprimi litteras putidius nolo obscurari neglegentius,</quote> <trans><tr>with affected distinctness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:10" default="NO">9, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:40 al" default="NO">40 al.</bibl>—Rarely of a personal object: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorem imitando effingere atque exprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderatorem rei publicae nostris libris diligenter expressimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">expressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">clearly exhibited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prominent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">express</hi> (syn. solidus, opp. adumbratus). </sense><sense id="n17115.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">species deorum, quae nihil concreti habeat, nihil solidi, nihil expressi, nihil eminentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 75</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae lituraeque omnes assimulatae, expressae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora lacertis expressa,</quote> <trans><tr>powerful</tr>, <tr>muscular</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">19: protinus omnibus membris, expressus infans,</quote> <trans><tr>fully formed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17115.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17115.10" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">habuit Catilina permulta maximarum non expressa signa, sed adumbrata virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">est gloria solida quaedam res et expressa, non adumbrata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit> (v. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:62, p. 723 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 62, p. 723 sq.</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">indicia solida et expressa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">veri juris germanaeque justitiae solida et expressa effigies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 17, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expressa sceleris vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expressiora et illustriora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 15, 3</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quid expressius atque signatius in hanc causam?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17115.11" n="2" level="3"> Expressa carmina Battiadae, <hi rend="ital">translated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:65:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 65, 16</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi> pronunciation: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia oris emendet, ut expressa sint verba, ut suis quaeque litterae sonis enuntientur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expressior sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expressior loquacitas generi picarum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 59, § 118</bibl></cit>. —In a bad sense, of a too emphatic, affected pronunciation: sonus erat dulcis: litterae neque expressae neque oppressae, ne aut obscurum esset aut putidum, Cic Off. 1, 37, 133.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">expressē</orth>. * </sense><sense id="n17115.12" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">with pressure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus expressius fricare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 198" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 198</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17115.13" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">expressly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscripta exempla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ipsum expressius Hesiodus hoc versu significavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:29" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—Of pronunciation, <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea (R littera) a nullo expressius efferretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 7, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exprobrabilis: <entryFree id="n17116" type="main" key="expro_^bra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exprō^brābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exprobro</etym>, <sense id="n17116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy of reproach</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 16 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
