exprobratio: <entryFree id="n17117" type="main" key="expro_^bra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exprō^brātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reproaching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upbraiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproach</hi> (syn. opprobrium; not in Cic.; cf.: probrum, opprobrium, crimen; <cit><quote lang="la">vituperatio, reprehensio, maledictum): cuiquam veteris fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 35, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec commemoratio quasi exprobratio est immemoris beneficii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levitatis puerilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 38, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exprobratione esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exprobrator: <entryFree id="n17118" type="main" key="expro_^bra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exprō^brātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who reproaches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a reproacher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upbraider</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 1, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exprobratrix: <entryFree id="n17119" type="hapax" key="expro_^bra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exprō^brātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exprobrator</etym>, <sense id="n17119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that reproaches</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upbraids</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:22:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exprobro: <entryFree id="n17120" type="main" key="expro_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-prō^bro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>probrum</etym>, <sense id="n17120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make a matter of reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cast in the teeth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to accuse of</hi> any thing; <pb n="699" /> <cb n="EXPU" /> also <hi rend="ital">to charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upbraid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproach</hi> a person with something (syn. obicere); constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquid in aliqua re</hi> or <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mos numquam fuit patri, ut exprobraret quod bonis faceret boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odiosum sane genus hominum officia exprobrantium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem suam in Philippi bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 49, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam quisque militiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 23, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num casus bellicos tibi exprobrare aut obicere videor?</quote> <trans><tr>to charge you with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:50:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 50, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia adversariis (al. in adversariis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:75:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 75, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam trepido amico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui de muliere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 5</bibl></cit>.—With an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergin' servum me exprobrare esse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 59</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 29, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid exprobras bene quod fecisti,</quote> <trans><tr>why make a fuss about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 37</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quor exprobras?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:143 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 143 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem verba mutata pronuntiatione indicant, affirmant, exprobrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:176" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est gratus jocus, qui minus exprobrat, quam potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:92" default="NO">11, 3, 92</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expromissor: <entryFree id="n17121" type="main" key="expro_missor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exprōmissor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>expromitto</etym>, <sense id="n17121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who promises to pay</hi> either for himself or for another (in jurid. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:53" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:4" default="NO">42, 1, 4</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
expromitto: <entryFree id="n17122" type="main" key="expro_mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-prōmitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, in mercant. lang., <sense id="n17122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to promise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">agree to pay</hi> for one's self or for another (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">nummos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:22" default="NO">16, 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expromo: <entryFree id="n17123" type="main" key="expro_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-prōmo</orth>, <itype>mpsi</itype> (msi), mptum (mtum), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forth</hi> (syn. proferre). </sense><sense id="n17123.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">heminas octo in urceum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox inde sensim ad mandendum manibus expromit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 72, 93, § 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maestas voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 280</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17123.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to show forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi> (class.; syn. proferre). </sense><sense id="n17123.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">exprome benignum ex tete ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid est incoctum non expromet, bene coctum dabit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicia in civis Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:53:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 53, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in meo inimico crudelitatem exprompsisti tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim eloquentiae in ea causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem industriam vitae et vigilandi laborem in antelucanis cenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid ego vestram crudelitatem expromo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:23:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 23, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel hilarissimum convivam hinc indidem expromam tibi,</quote> <trans><tr>I'll show myself to you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 72</bibl></cit>. (In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 9</bibl>, promat, v. Ritschl ad h. l.)—</sense><sense id="n17123.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">to utter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">exponere, narrare, etc.): occulta apud amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed jam exprome, si placet, istas leges de religione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multas mente querelas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:725" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 725</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">expromit, repertum in agro suo specum altitudine immensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in quamque sententiam dici possit, expromere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 72, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expromerent, quid sentirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignationem expromens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:19" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 19</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">expromptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc opus est tua mihi exprompta malitia atque astutia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exproperatus: <entryFree id="n17124" type="gloss" key="expro^pe^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exprŏpĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [‡ ex + propero], <sense id="n17124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hastened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurried</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">AQVILA FATIS,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>quickly overtaken</tr>, <tr>early cut off</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 669, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expudoratus: <entryFree id="n17125" type="hapax" key="expu^do_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pŭdōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pudor</etym>, <sense id="n17125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shameless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expugnabilis: <entryFree id="n17126" type="main" key="expugna_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pugnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>expugno</etym>, <sense id="n17126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be taken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carried</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">reduced by assault; expugnable</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">urbs terra marique expugnabilis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne magnis quidem exercitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">situ non expugnabile robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:103" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>exhaustible</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 836</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expugnans: <entryFree id="n17127" type="main" key="expugnans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expugnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from expugno.</entryFree>
expugnatio: <entryFree id="n17128" type="main" key="expugna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expugnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>expugno</etym>, <sense id="n17128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the taking of a place by assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carrying by storm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">storming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mytilenarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ipsorum adventus in urbes sociorum non multum ab hostili expugnatione differant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cb n="EXPU" /> castrorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 41, 1</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnae aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc acie, nunc expugnationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:98:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 98, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expugnator: <entryFree id="n17129" type="main" key="expugna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expugnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>expugno</etym>, <sense id="n17129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the taker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stormer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conqueror</hi> of a place. </sense><sense id="n17129.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:50:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 50, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:16:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 16, 32</bibl></cit>: rex Demetrius Expugnator cognominatus (transl. of <foreign lang="greek">*poliorkhth/s</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 38, 39, § 126</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n17129.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecoris opimi lupus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:363" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 363</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17129.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitiae,</quote> <trans><tr>a violator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expugnatorius: <entryFree id="n17130" type="main" key="expugna_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expugnātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conquering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overpowering</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dominatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expugnax: <entryFree id="n17131" type="main" key="expugnax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expugnax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">victorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">controlling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effectual</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive expugnacior herba est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expugno: <entryFree id="n17132" type="main" key="expugno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pugno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (archaic <sense id="n17132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. fut.</hi> expugnassere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 55</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to take by assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to storm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: obsideo, oppugno, capio). </sense><sense id="n17132.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of places: <cit><quote lang="la">id (oppidum Noviodunum) ex itinere oppugnare conatus, expugnare non potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 14, 1 al.: nonnullas urbes per vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cirtam armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1144</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17132.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of other objects (things or persons), <hi rend="ital">to subdue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweep away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 15, 2</bibl></cit> and 5: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">villas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippum et Nabin expugnatos,</quote> <trans><tr>conquered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 25, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inclusos moenibus expugnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">expugnavi amanti herili filio aurum ab suo patre,</quote> <trans><tr>obtained by force</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina id oppidum expugnavere,</quote> <trans><tr>swept away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euphrates Taurum expugnat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>breaks through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 24, 20, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacte equino venena et toxica expugnantur,</quote> <trans><tr>are counteracted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 10, 45, § 159</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17132.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to conquer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientis animus magnitudine consilii, tolerantia, virtutibus, etc. ... vincetur et expugnabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam munitum, quod non expugnari pecuniā possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunas patrias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to violate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut enim expugnatur intentio aut adsumptio aut conclusio, nonnumquam omnia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is refuted</tr>, <tr>confuted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:20 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 20 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinaciam legatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:56:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 56, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expugnatus precibus uxoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so simply expugnatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coepta,</quote> <trans><tr>to fight through</tr>, <tr>to accomplish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 619</bibl></cit>; cf.: sibi legationem expugnavit, <hi rend="ital">extorted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrung out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtained</hi> (= extorsit), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:16:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 16, § 44</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqua ratione expugnasset iste, ut dies tollerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegre expugnavit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 108</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pugnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">efficient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficacious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expugnantior herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 21</bibl></cit> (so Jahn and Bach., Merkel, expugnacior).</sense></entryFree>
expulsim: <entryFree id="n17133" type="main" key="expulsim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expulsim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>expulsus, from expello</etym>, <sense id="n17133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by driving out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away from one's self</hi>: pilā expulsim ludere, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 104, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expulsio: <entryFree id="n17134" type="main" key="expulsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expulsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>expello</etym>, <sense id="n17134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a driving out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expulsion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expulsiones vicinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:2:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laenatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expulso: <entryFree id="n17135" type="main" key="expulso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expulso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to expel</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si me (i. e. pilam) nobilibus scis expulsare sinistris, Sum tua,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive from one's self</tr>, <tr>drive back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:46:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 46, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: expulsim: Seleucia per duces expulsata, qs. <hi rend="ital">driven out of its seat</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdued</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expulsor: <entryFree id="n17136" type="main" key="expulsor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expulsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a driver out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expeller</hi> (very rare but class.): iste bonorum possessor, expulsor, ereptor, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 8, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyranni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expulsus: <entryFree id="n17137" type="main" key="expulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from expello.</entryFree>
expultrix: <entryFree id="n17138" type="hapax" key="expultrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expultrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>expello</etym>, <sense id="n17138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that drives out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">expels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophia, expultrix vitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expumico: <entryFree id="n17139" type="hapax" key="expu_mi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pūmĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub off with pumice-stone;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to cleanse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 16</bibl>. <cb n="EXQU" /></sense></entryFree>
expumo: <entryFree id="n17140" type="main" key="expu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expūmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. exspumo.</entryFree>
expunctio: <entryFree id="n17141" type="main" key="expuncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expunctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>expungo, II. B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n17141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an execution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performance</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">operae meae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expunctor: <entryFree id="n17142" type="main" key="expunctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expunctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>expungo</etym>, <sense id="n17142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blotter-out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliterator</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Or. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
expunctrix: <entryFree id="n17143" type="main" key="expunctrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expunctrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who blots out</hi>: meritorum, Jul. ap. August. cont. Sec. Resp. Jul. 1, 37.</sense></entryFree>
expunctus: <entryFree id="n17144" type="main" key="expunctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from expungo.</entryFree>
expungo: <entryFree id="n17145" type="main" key="expungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pungo</orth>, <itype>unxi, unctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> * <sense id="n17145.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to prick out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nates jam diu sunt saepe expunctae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 67</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n17145.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17145.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To strike out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cross out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blot out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erase</hi> from a list <hi rend="ital">by points</hi> (set above or below). </sense><sense id="n17145.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to expunge</hi> a debt, <hi rend="ital">to discharge</hi> a soldier (mostly ante- and post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): ut expungatur nomen, ne quid debeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles pulchre centuriatus est expuncto in manipulo,</quote> <trans><tr>discharged</tr>, <tr>disbanded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurias judicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex causa desertionis notatus temporis, quo in desertione fuit, stipendiis expungitur,</quote> <trans><tr>is struck off from the roll</tr>, <tr>deprived of his pay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17145.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n17145.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To get out of the way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pupillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17145.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to blot out</hi> a score, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> an obligation (by returning the favor): <cit><quote lang="la">munus munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:40:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 40, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17145.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To settle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adjust</hi> an account, <hi rend="ital">to reckon up</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae rationes subscriptae et expunctae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:3:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ausus est annumerare posteris stellas ac sidera ad nomen expungere,</quote> <trans><tr>to reckon up</tr>, <tr>enumerate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 24, § 95</bibl></cit>: expungebantur milites laureati, <hi rend="ital">were checked off</hi>, sc. as destined to be rewarded, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17145.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fulfil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adventum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota et gaudia Caesarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
expuo: <entryFree id="n17146" type="main" key="expu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. exspuo.</entryFree>
expurgatio: <entryFree id="n17147" type="main" key="expurga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">expurgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>expurgo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n17147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a justification</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vindication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excuse</hi> (a Plautin. word): <cit><quote lang="la">habui expurgationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 3, 4</bibl> (Ritschl, expurigationem).</sense></entryFree>
expurgo: <entryFree id="n17148" type="main" key="expurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-purgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to purge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleanse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purify</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17148.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolabella quicquid emortuum est (trunci aut vitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capisterio quicquid exteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepras, psoras, lichenas, lentigines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 64, § 126</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: quae poterunt umquam satis expurgare (me) cicutae? i. e. <hi rend="ital">to cure of poetic ecstasy</hi>, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus fermentum,</quote> <trans><tr>remove by cleansing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17148.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: expurgandus est sermo, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:258" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 74, 258</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17148.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to clear from censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exculpate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vindicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">justify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me expurgare tibi volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine me expurgem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non facile est expurgatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese parum expurgat,</quote> <trans><tr>fails to vindicate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 69:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 69, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">requirens objecta et expurgaturum asseverans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem consiliumque publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">expurgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear; comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> Orig. de Princ. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exputesco: <entryFree id="n17149" type="hapax" key="expu_tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pūtesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n17149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putrefy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestina tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exputo: <entryFree id="n17150" type="main" key="expu^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-pŭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n17150.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lop off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to crop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteranam vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:15:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:31" default="NO">5, 6, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17150.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17150.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To consider well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to examine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utramque rem simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id exputando evolvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 26, 42</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17150.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fathom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehend</hi>: quae mens eum aut quorum consilia a tanta gloria avocarint, exputare non possum, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exquaero: <entryFree id="n17151" type="main" key="exquaero"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exquaero</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. exquiro <sense id="n17151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exquiliae: <entryFree id="n17152" type="main" key="Exqui^li^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Exquĭlĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum, and its derivatives</itype>, v. Esquiliae.</entryFree>
exquiro: <entryFree id="n17153" type="main" key="exqui_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-quīro</orth> (in Plautus also exquaero, Bacch. 4, 4, 70 al.), <itype>sīvi, sītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to search out diligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to seek for; to make inquiry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ask</hi> (syn.: requiro, inquiro, investigo, perscrutor; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. and class.): cum ex te causas divinationis exquirerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:20:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a te nihildum certi exquiro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: sed haec non nimis exquiro a Graecis, <hi rend="ital">to ask</hi> <pb n="700" /> <cb n="EXSA" /> <hi rend="ital">of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expect from</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancillas dedo, quolibet cruciatu exquire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exquisiturum se vel fidiculis de Caesonia sua, cur, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>that he would search out even by the rack</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem ego dicam, si me exquiret miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secum et cum aliis, quid in eo peccatum sit, exquirunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:147" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omissis auctoritatibus ipsa re ac ratione exquirere veritatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 17, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleratum frigus,</quote> <trans><tr>to find out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum,</quote> <trans><tr>to search into</tr>, <tr>investigate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 12, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 36, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta alicujus ad antiquae religionis rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:5:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba exquisita ad sonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 49, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes agitare et exquirere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinere exquisito per Divitiacum,</quote> <trans><tr>having ascertained the route</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 41, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">exquire de Blesamio, numquid ad regem contra dignitatem tuam scripserit,</quote> <trans><tr>inquire respecting Blesamius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 15, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de Varrone tam diligenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eis senatus arbitratur singularis exquirendos honores,</quote> <trans><tr>to devise</tr>, <tr>invent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc mihi exquisitum est, fuisse hunc, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>I am accurately informed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mi istuc primum exquisito est opus,</quote> <trans><tr>I must first inquire respecting this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 159</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 81</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">A. and S. Gr. § 243, R. 1: consilia exquirentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-quīsītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">carefully sought out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ripely considered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exquisite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi omnia, quorum negotium est, consulta ad nos et exquisita deferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reconditae exquisitaeque sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exquisitum judicium litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 37, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exquisitis rationibus confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summis ingeniis exquisitaque doctrina philosophi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:41:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 41, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:27:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 27, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 27, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munditia non odiosa neque exquisita nimis,</quote> <trans><tr>too exquisite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil elegans, nihil exquisitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 119</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accuratius et exquisitius dicendi genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Brut. 82:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Brut. 82, 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudantur exquisitissimis verbis legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad exquisitissimam consuetudinem Graecorum aliquem erudire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia exquisitissimae subtilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 33, 39, § 211</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17153.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sought out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascertained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made certain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satin istuc mihi exquisitumst?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 105</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exquīsīte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exquisitely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de eo crimine accurate et exquisite disputavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:277" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 80, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eleganter atque exquisite dicere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:93:322" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 93, 322</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 75</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, Tiro Tull. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:7:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 7, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exquisitim: <entryFree id="n17154" type="hapax" key="exqui_si_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exquīsītim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>exquisitus, from exquiro</etym>, i. q. exquisite, <sense id="n17154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precisely</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 513, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exquisitio: <entryFree id="n17155" type="main" key="exqui_si_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exquīsītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exquiro</etym>, <sense id="n17155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">research</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquiry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigation</hi> (in jurid. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 17, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17155.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A seeking for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devising</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idolorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 14, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exquisitor: <entryFree id="n17156" type="main" key="exqui_si_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exquīsītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an investigator</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Baruch, 3, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exquisitus: <entryFree id="n17157" type="main" key="exqui_si_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exquīsītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exquiro.</entryFree>
exradicitus: <entryFree id="n17158" type="main" key="exra_di_ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exrādīcĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ērād-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n17158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from the very roots</hi>, climax after radicitus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subvertendam censeo radicitus, immo vero Plautino irati verbo exradicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:page=239" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> p. 239</bibl></cit>, ed. II. Mai.</sense></entryFree>
exradico: <entryFree id="n17159" type="main" key="exra_di_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exrādīco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. eradico.</entryFree>
exrogare: <entryFree id="n17160" type="gloss" key="exro^ga_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exrŏgāre</orth> <itype>est ex lege vetere aliquid eximere per novam legem</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=82:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 82, 2</bibl> Müll. (usually abrogo).</entryFree>
exsacrifico: <entryFree id="n17161" type="hapax" key="exsa_^cri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sā^crĭfĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exacr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n17161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sacrifice</hi>: exsacrificabat hostiis balantibus, Poëta (Enn.) ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:21:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 21, 42</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Fragm. p. 98</bibl> Vahl.)</sense></entryFree>
exsaevio: <entryFree id="n17162" type="hapax" key="exsaevi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-saevĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exaev-</orth>), <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n17162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rage itself out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cease raging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stetit ibi, dum reliquum tempestatis exsaeviret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 39, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsanguesco: <entryFree id="n17163" type="main" key="exsanguesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsanguesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n17163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [exsanguis], <hi rend="ital">to become pale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow faint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>: (mens) ad omnia exsanguescens dubia, Jul. ap. August. cont. Sec. Resp. Jul. 6, 14. <cb n="EXSC" /></sense></entryFree>
exsanguinatus: <entryFree id="n17164" type="hapax" key="exsangui^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsanguĭnātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exang-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exsanguis</etym>, <sense id="n17164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deprived of blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bloodless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsan. et exsucta animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
exsanguis: <entryFree id="n17165" type="main" key="exsanguis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sanguis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exang-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n17165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deprived of blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bloodless</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17165.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde animantum copia tanta Exos et exsanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 721</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacens et concisus plurimis vulneribus, extremo spiritu exsanguis et confectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 37, 79</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exsanguis et mortuus concidisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes enervati atque exsangues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsanguia corpora mortuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:49:section=130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 49, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 401</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17165.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wan</hi>: genae, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsanguis metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 224</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diffugimus visu exsangues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 267</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuminum,</quote> <trans><tr>making pale</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 18</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cuminum omne pallorem bibentibus gignit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 57, § 159</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">horror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 2, 130</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17165.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">powerless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aridum et exsangue orationis genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 11, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exsanguis et attritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox nimis exilis et exsanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsangues crudescunt luctibus anni (senectutis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:323" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 325</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsanio: <entryFree id="n17166" type="main" key="exsa^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sănĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exan-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sanies</etym>, <sense id="n17166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to free from matter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">corruption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to suppurate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cleanse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dress</hi> a wound, etc. (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n17166.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus (sal aridus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressam bacam,</quote> <trans><tr>to press out the juice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 47, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinapi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:57:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 57, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salsuram carnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:55:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 55, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterani, quamvis confossi, patienter et sine gemitu velut aliena corpora exsaniari patiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17166.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amaritudinem et pallorem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to extract</tr>, <tr>remove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:55" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsarcio: <entryFree id="n17167" type="main" key="exsarcio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sarcio</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">exarcio, exser-cio</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">exercio</orth>), no <sense id="n17167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sartum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> —<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to patch up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mend;</hi> hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">to amend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi> (very rare): exercirent sarcirent, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=81" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 81</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis te id rebus exsarturum esse persuadeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 11:45" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 11, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos servos qui opere rustico Faciundo facile sumptum exercirent suum,</quote> <trans><tr>who could repay their cost by their labor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 91</bibl></cit> Umpfenbach (Bentl. Fleck. al. exercerent).</sense></entryFree>
exsatio: <entryFree id="n17168" type="main" key="exsa^tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sătio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exat-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to satisfy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to satiate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sate</hi> (not ante-Aug.; cf. exsaturo). </sense><sense id="n17168.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsatiati cibo vinoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 28, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17168.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">enses multo cruore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:535" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 535</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:14" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clade exsatiata domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 542</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Populum Romanum ne morte quidem P. Scipionis exsatiari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:54:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 54, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patruum sanguine domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsaturabilis: <entryFree id="n17169" type="hapax" key="exsa^tu^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsătŭrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exsaturo</etym>, <sense id="n17169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be satiated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 781</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsaturo: <entryFree id="n17170" type="main" key="exsa^tu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sătŭro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exat-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to satisfy completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to satiate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sate</hi> (syn. explere; <cit><quote lang="la">rare but class.): belua exsaturanda visceribus meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: quae exsaturata lubido hausit, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:35:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 35, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ejus cruciatu atque supplicio pascere oculos animumque exsaturare vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odiis exsaturata quievi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 298</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:176" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 176</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exscalpo: <entryFree id="n17171" type="main" key="exscalpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-scalpo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shape.</hi> —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to frame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare</hi>, of a passage in verse: hunc locum nostra poetica scabies coepit exscalpare, Auson. Idyl. 11 praef.</sense></entryFree>
exscendo: <entryFree id="n17172" type="main" key="exscendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exscendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. escendo.</entryFree>
exscensio: <entryFree id="n17173" type="main" key="exscensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exscensĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">excens-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>escendo, II.; cf. ex, IV. B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n17173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a debarkation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">landing;</hi> usu. with facere (repeatedly in Liv.; elsewh. rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Caes.): quinqueremibus septem profectus ad Erythras exscensionem fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 17, 9</bibl> Drak.; 21, 51, 5; 22, 20, 4 et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam in continentem excensiones faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 31, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 28, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exscindo: <entryFree id="n17174" type="main" key="exscindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-scindo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exc-</orth>), <itype>ĭdi, issum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (lit., to tear out; hence, in gen.), <sense id="n17174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to extirpate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> (syn.: delere, evertere, vastare). </sense><sense id="n17174.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">templum sanctitatis, etc. ... inflammari, exscindi, funestari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 33, 90</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 41, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 61, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 44, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 27, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pergama Argolicis telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 643</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro sceleratam gentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17174.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to tear away</hi>: <cb n="EXSE" /> fortine animam hanc exscindere dextra indignum est visum? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:674" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 674</bibl>. (In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:34:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 34, 2</bibl>, read excidisti).</sense></entryFree>
exscreabilis: <entryFree id="n17175" type="main" key="exscre^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exscrĕābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">excr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exscreo</etym>, <sense id="n17175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be hawked up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coughed out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia pulmonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 55, § 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exscreatio: <entryFree id="n17176" type="main" key="exscre^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exscrĕātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">excr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hawking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coughing up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 91, § 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:195" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 12, 53, § 195</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exscreatus: <entryFree id="n17177" type="main" key="exscre^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exscrĕātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">excr-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hawking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coughing up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:11:128" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 11, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:10:119" default="NO">5, 10, 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exscreo: <entryFree id="n17178" type="main" key="exscre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-scrĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">excr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hawk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cough up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spit out by coughing</hi>: per tussim exscreatur, si tolerabilis morbus est, pituita; <cit><quote lang="la">si gravis, sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 92, § 145</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, age, usque excrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam exscreare ausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exscribo: <entryFree id="n17179" type="main" key="exscri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-scrībo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">excr-</orth>), <itype>psi, ptum</itype> (btum), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to write out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">write off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17179.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): tabulas in foro summa hominum frequentia exscribo; <cit><quote lang="la">adhibentur in exscribendo ex conventu viri primarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complura exscripta de Magonis libris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Plauti comoedia duos versus exscripsimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17179.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n17179.3" n="1" level="3"> Of paintings, <hi rend="ital">to copy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imagines exscribere et pingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 28, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17179.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to write</hi> or <hi rend="ital">note down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina exscripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonos in aliis tabulis exscriptos habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17179.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to copy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to resemble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia totum patrem mira similitudine exscripserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 16, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exscriptus: <entryFree id="n17180" type="main" key="exscriptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exscriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exscribo.</entryFree>
exsculpo: <entryFree id="n17181" type="main" key="exsculpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sculpo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exculp-</orth>), <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n17181.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To dig out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chisel out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carve.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17181.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram unde exsculpserant, fossam vocabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=143" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 143</bibl></cit> Müll.: foramina arborum exsculpta digitos sex. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid e quercu exsculpseram, quod videretur simile simulacri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum ex molari lapide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:19:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17181.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, prov.: leoni esurienti ex ore exsculpere praedam, said of any thing exceedingly difficult or daring, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 102, 22</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n17181.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to get out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elicit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aliquo verum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quaestione vix exsculpsi, ut diceret,</quote> <trans><tr>obtained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17181.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To scratch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos versus Lacedaemonii exsculpserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsculptio: <entryFree id="n17182" type="main" key="exsculpti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsculptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exsculpo</etym>, <sense id="n17182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chiselling out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finishing</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> in Joan. Tr. 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsecatio: <entryFree id="n17183" type="main" key="exse^ca_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsĕcātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exseco</etym>, another form of exsectio, <sense id="n17183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excision</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exseco: <entryFree id="n17184" type="main" key="exse^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sĕco</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">exĕco</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭco</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 34</bibl>), cŭi, ctum, 1 (<sense id="n17184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> exsecaveris, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 42</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to cut out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17184.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17184.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosas partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestem aliquam tamquam strumam civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 65, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu (frontis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetum ventri,</quote> <bibl
