n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium alicui mortuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:132" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundum armarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 64, 179</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17184.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">castrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">geld</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus haec opinio Graeciam opplevit exsectum Caelum a filio Saturno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:24:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 24, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 2, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a Greek construction: infelix ferro mollita juventus Atque exsecta virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17184.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsectus et exemptus honoribus senatoriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of interest: <cit><quote lang="la">quinas hic capiti mercedes exsecat (=extorquet, extundit),</quote> <trans><tr>cuts out</tr>, <tr>deducts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsecrabilis: <entryFree id="n17185" type="main" key="exse_^cra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsē^crābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">execr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exsecror</etym>. <sense id="n17185.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execrable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accursed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detestable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsecr. ac dirum solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:15" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil exsecrabilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 48, 72, § 155</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Levit. 11, 23 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17185.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execrating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeeuntibus exsecrabile carmen sacerdotibus,</quote> <trans><tr>the song of cursing</tr>, <tr>of execration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>raging</tr>, <tr>fearful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exsē^crābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">execrably</hi> (only in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">tanto exsecrabilius me oderam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsecrabilitas: <entryFree id="n17186" type="main" key="exse_^cra_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsē^crābĭlĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">execr-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">execrableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abominableness</hi> (post <pb n="701" /> <cb n="EXSE" /> class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitia pariunt exsecrabilitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsecrabiliter: <entryFree id="n17187" type="main" key="exse_^cra_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsē^crābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. exsecrabilis <sense id="n17187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exsecramentum: <entryFree id="n17188" type="main" key="exse_^cra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsē^crāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">execr-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>exsecror</etym>, <sense id="n17188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">execration</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Jud. 5</bibl> dub.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 15, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsecratio: <entryFree id="n17189" type="main" key="exse_^cra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsē^crātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">execr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n17189.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Execration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">malediction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thyestea ista exsecratio est: ut tu naufragio expulsus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exierunt malis omnibus atque exsecrationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 33, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:22" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 19 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 19 praef.</bibl> § 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:58:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 58, 13 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17189.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17189.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A solemn oath with an imprecation</hi> (if broken): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem exsecratione devincire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi fides? ubi exsecrationes? ubi dextrae complexusque?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:40:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 40, § 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 13, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 25, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 15, 15</bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n17189.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An abomination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a thing to be execrated</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Levit. 18, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsecrator: <entryFree id="n17190" type="main" key="exse_^cra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsē^crātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">execr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an execrator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detester</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 166" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 166 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
exsecratus: <entryFree id="n17191" type="main" key="exse_^cra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsē^crātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">execr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exsecror.</entryFree>
exsecror: <entryFree id="n17192" type="main" key="exse_^cror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sē^cror</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">execr-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n17192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sacer</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to curse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execrate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17192.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: abominor, detestor, abhorreo, horreo, aversor, devoveo): te oderunt, tibi pestem exoptant, te exsecrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40, 96</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">(with male precari),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:12:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 12, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia Catilinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severitatem nimiam et assidua belli pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbiam regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:7:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in se ac suum ipsius caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsecratus deinde in caput regnumque Prusiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsecratur Thyestes, ut naufragio pereat Atreus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba exsecrantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 105</bibl></cit> et saep.—* </sense><sense id="n17192.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take a solemn oath with imprecations</hi> (against its infringement): <cit><quote lang="la">eamus omnis execrata civitas (= his votis cum exsecratione conceptis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:36" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. v. 18.!*? * </sense><sense id="n17192.3" n="1" level="3"> Also, <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exsecro</orth>, āre: exsecrabant se ac suos, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 473, 24</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n17192.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">exsē^crātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass. signif.</hi> and as <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">accursed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execrable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detestable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non te exsecratum populo Romano, non detestabilem, etc. ... scias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: exsules duo, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 792</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">columna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 21, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsecratissima auguria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17192.5" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">exsē^-crandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, as <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">detestable</hi> (late Lat.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Levit. 11, 10</bibl>: libido, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 6, 4, 2 Huschke.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsecrandissimum nefas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. D. 7, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsectio: <entryFree id="n17193" type="main" key="exsecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsectĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exect-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exseco</etym>, <sense id="n17193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa conscelerata linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:67:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 67, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundi in armario,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 64, 180</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">mammarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 165</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsector: <entryFree id="n17194" type="main" key="exsector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsector</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exect-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id. I. B.</etym>, <sense id="n17194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who mutilates</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsectus: <entryFree id="n17195" type="main" key="exsectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exect-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exseco.</entryFree>
exsecutio: <entryFree id="n17196" type="main" key="exse^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsĕcūtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exec-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exsequor</etym>, <sense id="n17196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accomplishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execution</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n17196.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">instituti operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 53</bibl></cit>: legis, Front. Aquaed. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n17196.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n17196.3" n="A" level="2"> In jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">a judicial prosecution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indictment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delictorum quorundam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminis, delicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:131" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 131 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:178:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 178, § 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17196.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Jurisdiction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">official authority</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsecutionem ejus negotii libens suscepit (Corbulo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syriae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>administration</tr>, <tr>government</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17196.5" n="C" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">a discussion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete treatment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">differam hoc in praesenti: desiderat enim propriam et longam exsecutionem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 52" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3 praef" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 3 praef.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsecutiones rerum vitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 2, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsecutor: <entryFree id="n17197" type="main" key="exse^cu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsĕcūtor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exec-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accomplisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">executor</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n17197.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">acerrimus malorum propositorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:45" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 197</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17197.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in jurid. lang., </sense><sense id="n17197.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A prosecutor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revenger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensarum inimicitiarumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17197.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A collector</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 17, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsecutorius: <entryFree id="n17198" type="main" key="exse^cu_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsĕcūtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exsecutor</etym>, <sense id="n17198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">executive</hi>: vel judiciaria vel exsecutaria <cb n="EXSE" /> potestate facere, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Cont. Petil. 3, 25, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsecutus: <entryFree id="n17199" type="main" key="exse^cu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsĕcūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exec-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exsequor.</entryFree>
exsensus: <entryFree id="n17200" type="hapax" key="exsensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sensus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exens-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n17200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">void of feeling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senseless</hi>: mens, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsequens: <entryFree id="n17201" type="main" key="exse^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsĕquens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exequ-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exsequor.</entryFree>
exsequiae: <entryFree id="n17202" type="main" key="exse^qui^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsĕquĭae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exequ-</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exsequor, I. B.</etym>. <sense id="n17202.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A funeral procession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">funeral obsequies</hi> (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: funus, pompa, justa, inferiae, feralia): funus, quo amici convenerant ad exsequias cohonestandas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequias funeris prosequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:71:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 71, 201</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">funus innumeris exsequiis celebratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 43, 60, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clodii cadaver spoliatum imaginibus, exsequiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justis exsequiarum, id. Leg, 2, 17, 42: fertur in exsequiis matrona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:847" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 847</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequiis rite solutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequias ire,</quote> <trans><tr>to go to the funeral</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 8, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:395" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 395</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:50:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 50, 10 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n17202.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in late Lat., for reliquiae, <hi rend="ital">the earthly remains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relics</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humiliter sepultae Neronis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2</bibl>; Sext. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Brev. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsequialis: <entryFree id="n17203" type="main" key="exse^qui^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsĕquĭālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exequ-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exsequiae</etym>, <sense id="n17203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a funeral</hi>, <hi rend="ital">funereal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <trans><tr>dirges</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 430</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exsĕquĭālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">funeral rites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:610" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 610</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsequior: <entryFree id="n17204" type="main" key="exse^qui^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsĕquĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exequ-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to perform the funeral rites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bury</hi> (ante-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 107, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 48, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsequor: <entryFree id="n17205" type="main" key="exse^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sĕquor</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">exĕquor</orth>, <itype>cūtus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n17205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to follow to the end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pursue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17205.1" n="I" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accompany to the grave</hi> (cf. the deriv. exsequiae): funus, Massur. Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:16:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 16, 25</bibl>: aliquem omni laude et laetitia, Cic. poëta in Tusc. 1, 48, 115 (a transl. of <foreign lang="greek">e)kpe/mpein</foreign>, in Eurip.).</sense><sense id="n17205.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (class.; most freq. in the special significations). </sense><sense id="n17205.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompany; to go after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pursue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae exanimata exsequitur aspectum tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: quid petam praesidi aut exsequar? Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 112 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">non igitur dubium, quin aeternitatem maluerit exsequi, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to follow after</tr>, <tr>take pattern after</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non omnes fatum illius (Pompei) una exsecuti sumus?</quote> <trans><tr>followed</tr>, <tr>pursued</tr>, <tr>subjected ourselves to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sectam meam exsecutae comites,</quote> <trans><tr>joined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam quisque spem, sua consilia, communibus deploratis, exsequentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: aerumnam, qs. <hi rend="ital">to pursue</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to undergo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">egestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17205.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17205.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To follow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosecute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry out; to perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fulfil</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">conficio, perficio, perago, consummo, patro, perpetro, absolvo): nullam rem oportet dolose aggrediri, nisi Astute accurateque exsequare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">est difficile id non exsequi usque ad extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptum hoc itiner perficere exsequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 72</bibl></cit> and 88: <cit><quote lang="la">incepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata vestra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia regis officia et munera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 10, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">munus officii (with tueri),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus (with fungi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:7:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 23, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem cum aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to converse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: cum civitas armis jus suum exsequi conaretur, <hi rend="ital">to assert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comptam et mitem orationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 9, 28</bibl></cit>.—With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem locum ipse capturus esset, cogitando aut quaerendo exsequebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa omnia cum cura inquirendo exequebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22</bibl></cit>. 3, 2.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi Exsequi certa res est, ut abeam Potius hinc ad forum, quam domi cubem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17205.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go through with in speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">describe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tell</hi> (freq. since the Aug. period): <cit><quote lang="la">quae vix verbis exsequi possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam exsecuti sunt verbosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 15</bibl></cit>: si omnia exsequi<cb n="EXSI" />  velim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 27, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia copiosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae diligentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae divine in Oratore (Tullius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestia dona aërii mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes brassicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 33, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum subtiliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetera facunde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imagines et elogia universi generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17205.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pursue with punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to punish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avenge</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia scire, non omnia exsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum hominumque violata jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 25, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias accusationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris exsequendi jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justum dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 5, 33</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: pater caedetur? defendam: caesus est? exsequar, Sen. de Ira, 1, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:9:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 9, 22</bibl>.—Once with a <hi rend="ital">pers. object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me L. Tarquinium Superbum cum scelerata coniuge, etc., ferro, igni exsecuturum,</quote> <trans><tr>to pursue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59, 1</bibl></cit> (MSS.; Weissenb. et al. exacturum).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">exsĕ-quens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exeq-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">searching after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">studious of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriarum veterum exsequentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:12:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 12, 9</bibl></cit>.!*? <orth extent="full" lang="la">exsequi</orth> as <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: quaerebatur an prioris judicis sententia exsequi possit, <hi rend="ital">could be carried out</hi> (cf. II. B. supra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 1, 19</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">exsĕcūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exec-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass. signif.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsecuto regis imperio,</quote> <trans><tr>executed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsercio: <entryFree id="n17206" type="main" key="exserci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sercĭo</orth>, v. exercio.</entryFree>
exsero: <entryFree id="n17207" type="main" key="exsero"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sero</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">exĕro</orth>, <itype>rŭi, rtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n17207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a.; to stretch out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thrust out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take out</hi> (mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n17207.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallus linguam ab irrisu exserens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam per os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 27, 43, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum subter togam ad mentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brachia aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:838" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 838</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: caput ab Oceano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 598</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">herba Exserit e tepida molle cacumen humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:814" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 814</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creverat infans Quaerebatque viam, qua se exsereret,</quote> <trans><tr>might come forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se domicilio (cochleae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 32, 51, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicem ejus exserito,</quote> <trans><tr>take out</tr>, <tr>tear up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:58:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 58, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to throw off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 8, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17207.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of parts of the body, exsertus, a, um, <hi rend="ital">protruding from the dress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncovered</hi>: dextris humeris exsertis, <hi rend="ital">bared</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 50, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 492</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:346" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 346</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">transf. of the person: exsertus humero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:587" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 587</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in Greek construction: exserti ingentes humeros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:235" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum exserta latus Camilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 649</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truces exserta manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:207" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 207</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsertique manus vesana Cethegi,</quote> <trans><tr>tucked up</tr>, <tr>prepared for the fight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:681" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 681</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17207.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17207.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">exseram in librum tuum jus, quod dedisti,</quote> <trans><tr>will avail myself of</tr>, <tr>make use of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreta mentis ore exserit,</quote> <trans><tr>discloses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 255" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 255</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17207.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to reveal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, with an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulatim principem exseruit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>showed himself as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 33</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">exsertus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exert-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n17207.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Thrust forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projecting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes apro, elephanto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 61, § 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17207.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conspicuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exserto bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:39" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cachinnus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unrestrained</tr>, <tr>loud</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 103, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsertior opera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Paneg. ad Theod. 35</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">exserte</orth> (acc. to B.), <hi rend="ital">openly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loudly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamitans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consurgere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egit tribunatum (with severissime),</quote> <trans><tr>very strictly</tr>, <tr>rigorously</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exserte: <entryFree id="n17208" type="main" key="exserte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsertē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exert-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. exsero, <sense id="n17208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
exserto: <entryFree id="n17209" type="main" key="exserto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exserto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exert-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>exsero</etym>. <sense id="n17209.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scyllam Ora exsertantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 425</bibl></cit>: linguam, Claud. Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacertos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurem per aulaeum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>listening eagerly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17209.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to exsero, I. B.) <hi rend="ital">To uncover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humeros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:412" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 412</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsertus: <entryFree id="n17210" type="main" key="exsertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsertus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exert-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exsero.</entryFree>
exsibilo: <entryFree id="n17211" type="main" key="exsi_bi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sībĭlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exīb-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hiss out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17211.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (only postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">dirum quiddam, Sen. de Ira, 3, 4: nescio quid tetrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 64</bibl></cit>: confestim praesentiam nostram efflari exsibilarique <pb n="702" /> <cb n="EXSI" /> jusserit, <hi rend="ital">to be carried out by the wind</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 163, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17211.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to hiss off an actor</hi> from the stage (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">histrio exsibilatur et exploditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
exsiccatio: <entryFree id="n17212" type="main" key="exsicca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsiccātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exsicco</etym>, <sense id="n17212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drying up</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Fuga Saec. 6, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsiccatus: <entryFree id="n17213" type="main" key="exsicca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsiccātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exsicco.</entryFree>
exsiccesco: <entryFree id="n17214" type="hapax" key="exsiccesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-siccesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exicc-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n17214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dry up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become quite dry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exsicco: <entryFree id="n17215" type="main" key="exsicco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sicco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exicc-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dry up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make quite dry</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17215.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 242</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of an abstr. subject: <cit><quote lang="la">ebrietas, donec exsiccetur,</quote> <trans><tr>is exhaled</tr>, <tr>passes off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus tristis exsiccat ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:17:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 17, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17215.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to drain dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to empty</hi> a bottle (= epotare, cum aliqua aviditatis significatione): lagenae furtim exsiccatae, Q. Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 26, 2</bibl>; for which <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina culullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the sea: mare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Nahum, 1, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">exsiccātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exicc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">dried up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jejune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:291" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 84, 291</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsico: <entryFree id="n17216" type="main" key="exsi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exĭc-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, v. exseco.</entryFree>
exsigno: <entryFree id="n17217" type="main" key="exsigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-signo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exign-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to write out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">note down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">record</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia istaec quae tu dixti, scio, vel exsignavero,</quote> <trans><tr>I could write it down exactly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontifici sacra omnia exscripta exsignataque attribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsilio: <entryFree id="n17218" type="main" key="exsi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sĭlĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>ĭlŭi</itype> (exilivit, <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=206" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 206</bibl> M.; v. R<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:Com. Fragm. p. 118" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Com. Fragm. p. 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:N. Q. 2:49:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> N. Q. 2, 49, 3</bibl>: <sense id="n17218.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">exsilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Const. Sap. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:N. Q. 1:14:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. Q. 1, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:353" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 353</bibl>), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>salio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to spring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bound forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leap up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to start up</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">puer citus e cunis exilit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">properans de sella exsiluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:30:section=75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 30, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domo levis exsilit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gremio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:410" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut continuo exiliatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetu perturbatus exsiluisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:64:section=165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 64, § 165</bibl></cit>; cf.: exsilui gaudio, <hi rend="ital">I leaped for joy</hi>, Q. Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">protinus exsilui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 27</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad te exsilui,</quote> <trans><tr>I sprang to you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(anguis) exsilit in siccum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in obvia arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:111" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiluit partus de vulnere matris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 12:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 12, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17218.1" n="II" level="1"> Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero noster, a quo Romana eloquentia exsiluit,</quote> <trans><tr>took its rise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40, 11</bibl></cit>: et magno imperatori cor exsiluit, <hi rend="ital">with eager expectation</hi>, id. de Ira, 2, 3, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">tum quoque lumen Exsilit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 163</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 696</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus ut parte foras emergant exsiliantque (aquae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:522" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsiluere oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>started out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsiluere loco silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:406" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 406</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
exsilium: <entryFree id="n17219" type="main" key="exsi^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsĭlĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">exĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>exsul</etym>, <sense id="n17219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">banishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exile.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17219.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilium non supplicium est, sed perfugium portusque supplicii ... cum homines vincula, neces, ignominiasque vitant, quae sunt legibus constitutae, confugiunt quasi ad aram in exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:34:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 34, 100</bibl></cit>: exsilium triplex est; <cit><quote lang="la">aut certorum locorum interdictio, aut lata fuga, ut omnium locorum interdicatur praeter certum locum, aut insulae vinculum, id est relegatio in insulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:22:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilio et relegatione civium ulciscentes tribunos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with relegatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilium iis (terribile est), quibus quasi circumscriptus est habitandi locus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exacti in exsilium innocentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expulsus in exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsus in exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eicere aliquem in exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire, proficisci in exsilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 41, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere in exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 13, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3:2" default="NO">5, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 11:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. An. 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in exsilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:32:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 32, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de exsilio reducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocare de exilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 34, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab exsilio reducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab exsilio revocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 77</bibl>; 2, 92; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam redii de exsilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 106</bibl></cit> et saep.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">exilium patitur patriae qui se denegat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:158" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 158</bibl></cit> (Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n17219.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n17219.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A place of exile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a retreat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodvis exsilium his est optatius quam patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: Octavium et Antistium<cb n="EXSO" />  egressos exsilium, in easdem insulas redegit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutum orabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversa quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa patere fugienti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilium patria sede mutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17219.4" n="B" level="2"> (Abstr. pro concreto.) In <number>plur.</number>: exsilia, <hi rend="ital">those who are banished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exiles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenum exsiliis mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsinceratus: <entryFree id="n17220" type="spur" key="exsinceratus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsinceratus</orth>, ex conject. Camerarii in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 11</bibl>, v. Ritsch. ad h. l.</entryFree>
exsinuo: <entryFree id="n17221" type="main" key="exsi^nu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sĭnŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">amictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velum in contos suos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 49, 3</bibl></cit>: seriem laterum, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 11, 221.</sense></entryFree>
exsisto: <entryFree id="n17222" type="main" key="exsisto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sisto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">existo</orth>, <itype>stĭti, stĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (<sense id="n17222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Civ. D. 14, 13</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to step out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emerge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n17222.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n17222.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">e latebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab inferis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:37:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 37, § 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 37, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguem ab ara exstitisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 80 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: vocem ab aede Junonis ex arce exstitisse (shortly before: voces ex occulto missae; and: <cit><quote lang="la">exaudita vox est a luco Vestae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 45, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est bos cervi figura, cujus a media fronte inter aures unum cornu exsistit excelsius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">submersus equus voraginibus non exstitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nympha gurgite medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vero occultum, intestinum ac domesticum malum, non modo non exsistit, verum, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>does not come to light</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:15:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 15, § 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17222.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., with the accessory notion of originating, <hi rend="ital">to spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vermes de stercore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:871" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 871</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae a bruma sata sunt, quadragesimo die vix exsistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:34:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si qui dentes et pubertatem natura dicat exsistere, ipsum autem hominem, cui ea exsistant, non constare natura, non intelligat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac nimia licentia ait ille, ut ex stirpe quadam, exsistere et quasi nasci tyrannum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23, 80</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex luxuria exsistat avaritia necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 27, 75</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ut exsistat ex rege dominus, ex optimatibus factio, ex populo turba et confusio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut plerumque in calamitate ex amicis inimici exsistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:104:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 104, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: videtisne igitur, ut de rege dominus exstiterit? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo exsistit id civitatis genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus ex uberrimis sermonibus exstiterunt doctissimi viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex qua (disserendi ratione) summa utilitas exsistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:25:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 25, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo admirantium, unde hoc philosophandi nobis subito studium exstitisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsistit hoc loco quaestio subdifficilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 19, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna inter eos exsistit controversia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtam bonum neminem sine inflammatione animorum exsistere posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: exsistit illud, ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">it ensues</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 67</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo exsistet, ut de nihilo quippiam fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 9, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n17222.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be visible</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi> in any manner, <hi rend="ital">to exist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in corporibus magnae dissimilitudines sunt, sic in animis exsistunt majores etiam varietates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idque in maximis ingeniis exstitit maxime et apparet facillime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si exstitisset in rege fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus magnae exstiterunt res bellicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa pars animi, in qua irarum exsistit ardor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 29, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando aliquod officium exstitit amici in periculis adeundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ullum ingenium tantum exstitisse dicebat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">talem vero exsistere eloquentiam, qualis fuit in Crasso, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">nisi Ilias illa exstitisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus ego dignitatis ab adolescentia fautor, in praetura autem et in consulatu adjutor etiam exstitissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">his de causis ego huic causae patronus exstiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timeo, ne in eum exsistam crudelior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic insulsi exstiterunt, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 217</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsolesco: <entryFree id="n17223" type="main" key="exso^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sŏlesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exol-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n17223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become disused to</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">a disciplina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Verg. Vel. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsolutio: <entryFree id="n17224" type="main" key="exso^lu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŏlūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exsolvo</etym>. * <sense id="n17224.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A release</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharge</hi>, Capito ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=238" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 238</bibl>, <cb n="EXSO" /> 19 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n17224.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a payment</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius debiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:33" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 32, 1, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsolutus: <entryFree id="n17225" type="main" key="exso^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exsŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exsolvo.</entryFree>
exsolvo: <entryFree id="n17226" type="main" key="exsolvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-solvo</orth>, <itype>solvi, sŏlūtum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n17226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">per diaeresin</hi> exsolŭātur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 811</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsolŭïsse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:534" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 534</bibl></cit>; cf. solvo, <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unloose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to unbind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undo</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n17226.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17226.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 220</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Agedum, eam solve cistulam. <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Quid ego istam exsolvam? <hi rend="ital">undo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">properans exsolvi restim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenas Caecinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugionem a latere,</quote> <trans><tr>to ungird</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venas praebere exsolvendas,</quote> <trans><tr>to be opened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">brachia ferro eodem ictu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus,</quote> <trans><tr>to pull off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:53" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum exsoluta alvo transmisit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in a flux</tr>, <tr>diarrhœa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 15</bibl></cit>.—Of an inanimate subject: <cit><quote lang="la">(ignis) exsolvit glaciem,</quote> <trans><tr>dissolves</tr>, <tr>melts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:878" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 878</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17226.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17226.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vinclis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">exsolutus vinculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jube sis me exsolvi cito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:16 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 16 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese e nervis (animae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 696</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 811</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se paulatim corpore (said of one dying),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:829" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 829</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (sanguine),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17226.5" n="2" level="3"> In mercant. lang. (qs. to free from obligation, v. solvo, <hi rend="ital">to discharge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay</hi> a debt): nomina mea, per deos, expedi, exsolve (for which, shortly after: hoc quod debeo plane expedias et <hi rend="ital">solutum</hi> relinquas), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplicem sortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotem uxori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 56" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n17226.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17226.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to throw off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rid one's self of</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">legis nexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to lay aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:565" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur peditum ad exsolvendum obsidium ducit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to raise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 39</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17226.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17226.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To release</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi> from any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">animum artis nodis religionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:932" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 932</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos religione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum religione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 20,
