4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se occupationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem errore, suspicione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aere alieno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 652</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custode,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 46</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n17226.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To discharge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay</hi> a debt or an obligation: <cit><quote lang="la">de tertio genere se scripsit dicturum, nec exsolvit quod promiserat,</quote> <trans><tr>but did not keep his promise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota (deo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 21, 9</bibl> (opp. se obligare): <cit><quote lang="la">jus jurandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <trans><tr>to fulfil one's promise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 31, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia, poenas alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to award</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:40:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 40, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam recte factis, alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 25, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">grates,</quote> <trans><tr>to render</tr>, <tr>give</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia,</quote> <trans><tr>to repay</tr>, <tr>requite</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vicem beneficio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas morte,</quote> <trans><tr>to suffer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:88" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 88 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17226.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To solve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explain</hi> any thing enigmatical or obscure: <cit><quote lang="la">perfacile est parili ratione exsolvere nobis, quare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 381</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsomnis: <entryFree id="n17227" type="main" key="exsomnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-somnis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exomn-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>somnus</etym>, <sense id="n17227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sleepless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wakeful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watchful</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">insomnis, vigil, vigilans): vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:88:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 88, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tisiphone) Vestibulum exsomnis servat noctesque diesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 556</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:5" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo exsomnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:127" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 127 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
exsono: <entryFree id="n17228" type="main" key="exso^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sŏno</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n17228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to resound</hi> (postAug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ceteri convivae ingenti clamore exsonabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigium exsonat cantibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia risu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsorbeo: <entryFree id="n17229" type="main" key="exsorbe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sorbĕo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">exorbĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype> (<sense id="n17229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsorpsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Helv. 10:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Helv. 10, 9</bibl></cit>), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to suck out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suck</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sup up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suck in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drain</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17229.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 276, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:145" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 145</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustaras civilem sanguinem, vel potius exsorbueras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 52, 225</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. poët. Tusc. 2, 8, 20. —In mal. part.: viros,</quote> <trans><tr>to exhaust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:223" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 223</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17229.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam amborum,</quote> <trans><tr>to swallow up</tr>, <tr>to destroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Harusp. 27, 59</bibl></cit>: tristitiam alicui, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 102, 32</bibl>: multorum stultitiam perpessus est, <pb n="703" /> <cb n="EXSP" /> arrogantiam pertulit, difficultates exsorbuit, qs. <hi rend="ital">drained to the dregs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot congiaria principum et ingens Capitolii vectigal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Helv. Cons. 10:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Helv. Cons. 10, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsordesco: <entryFree id="n17230" type="hapax" key="exsordesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sordesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exord-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n17230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become defiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polluted;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen philosophiae illustrissimum in hominibus deterrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:2:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsors: <entryFree id="n17231" type="main" key="exsors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sors</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exors</orth>), <itype>sortis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n17231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without lot</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">who has not cast a lot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who obtains a thing out of course;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">that for which a lot has not been cast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chosen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choice.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17231.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">te voluit rex magnus Olympi Talibus auspiciis exsortem ducere honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducunt exsortem (equum) Aeneae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 552</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:340" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 340</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17231.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">having no share in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprived of.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17231.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae et foederis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 44, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimoniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cos exsors secandi,</quote> <trans><tr>incapable of cutting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 305</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17231.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes conflictui huic,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
exspargo: <entryFree id="n17232" type="main" key="exspargo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exspargo</orth>, v. exspergo.</entryFree>
exspatior: <entryFree id="n17233" type="main" key="exspa^ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-spătĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exp-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n17233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wander from the course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go out of the way; to spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend; to digress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expatiate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n17233.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspatiantur equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 202</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:454" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 454</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspatiata ruunt per apertos flumina campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:285" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:95" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores latissima umbra exspatiantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 30, 53, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brachium in latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 84</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17233.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis non erit, si exspatiari parte in hac et indulgere voluptati velim,</quote> <trans><tr>enlarge on this head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(juvenes) ut exspatientur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc exspatiandi genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exspectabilis: <entryFree id="n17234" type="main" key="exspecta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exspectābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expect-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>exspecto</etym>, <sense id="n17234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be expected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expected</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">juvenalium ludicro parum exspectabilem operam praebuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exspectatio: <entryFree id="n17235" type="main" key="exspecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exspectātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expect-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an awaiting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expectation</hi> (very freq. and class.; in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n17235.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si spes est exspectatio boni, mali exspectationem esse necesse est metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbior reliquorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:266" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 76, 266</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">poenarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta vel animi vel ingenii tui, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sustines non parvam exspectationem imitandae industriae nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorem exspectationem mei faciam quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Varronis sermo facit exspectationem Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotidiana rerum novarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximi belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus rei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:47:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 47, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:9:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit> et saep. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebras exspectationes nobis tui commoves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17235.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantam tu mihi moves exspectationem de sermone Bibuli!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenus sum exspectatione de Pompeio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17235.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo me major exspectatio tenet, quibusnam rationibus ea tanta vis comparetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:18:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 18, 74</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc has exspectationes habemus duas: unam, etc., alteram, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17235.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sis in exspectatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pendeo animi exspectatione Corfiniensi, in qua de salute rei publicae decernitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo plebem Romanam obscura spe et caeca exspectatione pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia spe et exspectatione laudata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 30, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in summam exspectationem adducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permagnam exspectationem imponere orationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M'. Curii causa nuper qua exspectatione defensa est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter exspectationem,</quote> <trans><tr>unexpectedly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra exspectationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectatione minor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra exspectationem omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:40:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 40, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectationibus decipiendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 289</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17235.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The object of expectation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">longing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:49:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 49, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Israel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:17:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 17, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pistorum laetitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. 10, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exspectator: <entryFree id="n17236" type="main" key="exspecta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exspectātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expect-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <cb n="EXSP" /> [id.], <sense id="n17236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spectator</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.</sense></entryFree>
exspectatrix: <entryFree id="n17237" type="main" key="exspecta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exspectātrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expect-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exspectator</etym>, <sense id="n17237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that expects</hi> or <hi rend="ital">awaits</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exspectatus: <entryFree id="n17238" type="main" key="exspecta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exspectātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expect-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from exspecto.</entryFree>
exspecto: <entryFree id="n17239" type="main" key="exspecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-specto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expect-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look out for a thing</hi> (syn.: prospecto, opperior, maneo, moror, praestolor). </sense><sense id="n17239.1" n="1" level="3"> Objectively, <hi rend="ital">to await</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expect</hi> something that is to come or to take place, <hi rend="ital">to be waiting for</hi>, etc. (very freq. and class.). —Constr. with the <case>acc.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">rel.-clauses</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">dum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> very rarely with <hi rend="ital">object-clause.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17239.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n17239.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ea Scipio dixisset silentioque omnium reliqua ejus exspectaretur oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transitum tempestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adventum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eventum pugnae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 49</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet ultima semper Exspectanda dies homini est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenantes haud animo aequo Exspectans comites,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>waiting till they have done eating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectandus erit annus,</quote> <trans><tr>I must wait a year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:42" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 42</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17239.4" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">relative</hi> and esp. <hi rend="ital">interrogative clauses</hi>: exspectabat populus atque ora tenebat rebus, utri magni victoria sit data regni, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. s. 90, ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">exspecto, quo pacto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspecto, quid ad ista,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:20:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 20, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38:section=92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38, § 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hostes consilii caperent, exspectabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectante Antonio, quidnam esset actura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne utile quidem, quam mox judicium fiat, exspectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:28:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 28, 85</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quid exspectas quam mox ego dicam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et, quam mox signis collatis dimicandum sit, in dies exspectet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 34, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 37, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectans, quando, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:159" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 159</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17239.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">dum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne exspectetis meas pugnas dum praedicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne exspectemus quidem, dum rogemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectas fortasse, dum dicat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectare, dum hostium copiae augerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dum repetatur, exspectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar non exspectandum sibi statuit, dum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero hoc loco exspectandum est, dum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticus exspectat, dum defluat amnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam dudum exspecto, si tuum officium scias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspecto si quid dicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc (paludem) si nostri transirent, hostes exspectabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 34, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi exspectare vis ut eam sine dote frater conlocet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea lenitas hoc exspectavit, ut id quod latebat, erumperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte exspectatis ut illa diluam, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque exspectant, ut de eorum imperio ad populum feratur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> ib. 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare nemo exspectet, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 31, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 18, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:8:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 8, 5 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ultra exspectato, quam dum Claudius Ostiam proficisceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnium voces audirentur, exspectari diutius non oportere, quin ad castra iretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17239.6" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">comites ad portam exspectare dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem ex die exspectabam, ut statuerem, quid esset faciendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectent paullum et agi ordine sinant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17239.7" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum expectaret effusos omnibus portis Aetolos in fidem suam venturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 22, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">venturum istum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 5:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17239.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of an abstract subject, like maneo, <hi rend="ital">to await</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu me tranquilla senectus Exspectat seu, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n17239.9" n="II" level="1"> To look for with hope, fear, desire, expectation, <hi rend="ital">to hope for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire; to fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anticipate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apprehend.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17239.10" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum est, ut tuam profectionem amore prosequar, reditum spe exspectem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod magna cum spe exspectamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit> E. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego jam aut rem aut ne spem quidem exspecto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 22</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: magnum inceptas, si id exspectas, quod <cb n="EXSP" /> nusquam'st, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (rem) avidissime civitas exspectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longiores (epistolas) exspectabo vel potius exigam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finem laborum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:85:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 85, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum ut vivat, optant, meam autem mortem exspectant scilicet,</quote> <trans><tr>to wish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama mortis meae non accepta solum sed etiam exspectata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in the pun with I.: cum Proculeius quereretur de filio, quod is mortem suam exspectaret, et ille dixisset, se vero non exspectare: Immo, inquit, rogo exspectes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 68</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quod magnum hoc nuntio exspecto malum,</quote> <trans><tr>dread</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis de causis Caesar majorem Galliae motum exspectans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: 7, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—With a personal object: <cit><quote lang="la">pater exspectat aut me aut aliquem nuntium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ite intro, filii vos exspectant intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ego mendacem usque puellam Ad mediam noctem exspecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 418</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">video jam, illum, quem exspectabam, virum, cui praeficias officio et muneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17239.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid ab</hi> (rarely ex) <hi rend="ital">aliquo</hi> (a favorite expression of Cicero): <cit><quote lang="la">a te hoc civitas vel omnes potius gentes non exspectant solum, sed etiam postulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixi Servilio, ut omnia a me majora exspectaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alimenta a nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliquo gloriam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 19</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristem censuram ab laeso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex iis (proletariis) quasi proles civitatis exspectari videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17239.12" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid ab</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ex aliqua re</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ab liberalitate alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedecus a philosopho,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ex sua amicitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 60, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17239.13" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid aliquem</hi> (very rare): ne quid exspectes amicos, quod tute agere possies, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29</bibl>; Sat. v. 38 Vahl.—</sense><sense id="n17239.14" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi hic adfers, quam ob rem exspectem aut sperem porro non fore?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspecto cupioque te ita illud defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:64:section=151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 64, § 151</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> alone (cf. cupio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad Ver. Imp. p. 137" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad Ver. Imp. p. 137</bibl>, ed. Rom.—</sense><sense id="n17239.15" n="6" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum mihi nihil improviso, nec gravius quam exspectavissem pro tantis meis factis evenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquando ad verum, ubi minime exspectavimus, pervenimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17239.16" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., of an abstr. subject, <hi rend="ital">to have need of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">require</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvarumque aliae pressos propaginis arcus Exspectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illae (oleae) procurvam exspectant falcem rastrosque tenaces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 421</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lenta remedia et segnes medicos non exspectant tempora mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">exspectātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expect-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">anxiously expected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longed for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">welcome</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">carus omnibus exspectatusque venies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">venies exspectatus omnibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus Hector ab oris exspectate venis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensi ego in exspectatis ad amplissimam dignitatem fratribus tuis,</quote> <trans><tr>who were expected to arrive at the highest dignities of the state</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 19, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi te exspectatum ejecisset foras,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>whose death is waited</tr>, <tr>longed for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis ille potuit exspectatior venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adventus suavissimus exspectatissimusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 4</bibl></cit> a: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:51" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17239.17" n="b" level="4"> In the <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis non diversa praesentibus contrariaque exspectatis aut speret aut timeat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:75:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 75, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hosti Ante exspectatum positis stat in agmine castris,</quote> <trans><tr>before it was expected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 348</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ante exspectatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 790</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille ad patrem patriae exspectato revolavit maturius,</quote> <trans><tr>than was expected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:123:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 123, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exspergo: <entryFree id="n17240" type="main" key="exspergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-spergo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-spargo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">experg-</orth>), no <sense id="n17240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>spersus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>spargo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to sprinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scatter abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disperse</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n17240.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspargi quo possint moenia mundi,</quote> <trans><tr>to be dispersed</tr>, <tr>diffused</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 371</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17240.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanieque exspersa natarent Limina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>besprinkled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 625</bibl></cit> (Rib. aspersa).</sense></entryFree>
exspersus: <entryFree id="n17241" type="main" key="exspersus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exspersus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expers-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exspergo. <pb n="704" /> <cb n="EXSP" /></entryFree>
exspes: <entryFree id="n17242" type="main" key="exspes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-spes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expes</orth>), <pos>adj.</pos> (only in the <sense id="n17242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">without hope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hopeless</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in Tac.). </sense><sense id="n17242.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: exspes liberūm, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 12, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17242.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus, inops, exspes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fractis enatat exspes Navibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exspiratio: <entryFree id="n17243" type="main" key="exspi_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exspīrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expīr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exspiro</etym>, <sense id="n17243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breathing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhalation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exspiro: <entryFree id="n17244" type="main" key="exspi_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-spīro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expīro</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic. and Caes.). <sense id="n17244.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to breathe out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to emit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blow out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exhale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give out</hi>: animam pulmonibus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 38, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam medios in ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen sanguinis de pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 354</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flammas pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odorem de corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonos per saxa (unda),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:285" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colorem (uniones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17244.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cadavera vermes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>send forth</tr>, <tr>produce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 720</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva comas tollit fructumque exspirat in umbras,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>spreads out into foliage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:70" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17244.2" n="C" level="2"> Exspirare animam, <hi rend="ital">to expire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">die</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 15 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17244.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17244.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To rush forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be exhaled.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17244.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">per fauces montis ut Aetnae Exspirent ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis foras (with exire in auras),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:886" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 886</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis fera ventorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">halitus Averni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:493" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguenta,</quote> <trans><tr>evaporate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 3, 4, § 20</bibl></cit>: vis, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 38, 30</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n17244.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae pectoris exspirantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 194</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17244.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To breathe one's last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to expire.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17244.8" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut per singulos artus exspiraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 30</bibl></cit> Dietsch.: <cit><quote lang="la">atram tundit humum exspirans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 731</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi perire jussus exspiravero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:91" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter primam curationem exspiravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter verbera et vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 19, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremus exspirantis hiatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:73" default="NO">9, 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:5:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 36, 36, § 122</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam membranā cerebri incisā statim exspiretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 67, § 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspiravit aper dentibus apri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:162" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 162</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17244.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to expire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come to an end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ego morerer, mecum exspiratura res publica erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 28, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertate jam exspirante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:57:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 57, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne res publica exspiraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:18" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminis causa exspirat,</quote> <trans><tr>becomes extinct</tr>, <tr>ceases</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:17:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 17, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:19" default="NO">24, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prior obligatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:58" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 45, 1, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exsplendesco: <entryFree id="n17245" type="main" key="exsplendesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-splendesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expl-</orth>), <itype>dŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n17245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shine forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glitter</hi> (rarely before the Aug. period). </sense><sense id="n17245.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sirius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 12, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17245.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shine forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be eminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarius exsplendescebat, quam condiscipuli animo aequo ferre possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis animique dotes exsplenduerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exspoliatio: <entryFree id="n17246" type="main" key="exspo^li^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exspŏlĭātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expol-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exspolio</etym>, <sense id="n17246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spoiling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plundering</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 20:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 20, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 18, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exspoliator: <entryFree id="n17247" type="main" key="exspo^li^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exspŏlĭātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expol-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pillager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunderer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. D. 7, p. 288</bibl></cit> Rittersh.</sense></entryFree>
exspolio: <entryFree id="n17248" type="main" key="exspo^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-spŏlĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expŏl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (dep. form exspoliantur, Poët. ap. Don. 1769 P.: exspoliabantur, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 480, 16</bibl>), <sense id="n17248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunder</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17248.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum Campanum, Quadrig. l. l.: ad expoliandum corpus, qui vulneraverat alacer gaudio accurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17248.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitu et provincia Pompeium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hos vestro auxilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem rerum selectione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem honorem et dignitatem Caesaris,</quote> <trans><tr>to deprive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:50:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 50, 4</bibl></cit> dub. (al. spoliare): <cit><quote lang="la">improbis sese artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exspretus: <entryFree id="n17249" type="main" key="exspre_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sprētus</orth>, v. expretus.</entryFree>
exspuitio: <entryFree id="n17250" type="hapax" key="exspu^i^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exspŭĭtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">exp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exspuo</etym>, <sense id="n17250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spitting out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 14, § 20</bibl></cit> (dub.; Jan. exspiationem).</sense></entryFree>
exspumo: <entryFree id="n17251" type="hapax" key="exspu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-spūmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expūm-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n17251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to froth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foam out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec inde humor exspumet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exspuo: <entryFree id="n17252" type="main" key="exspu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-spŭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">expuo</orth>), <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n17252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spit out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spit</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n17252.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ille gustasset et exspuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 146</bibl>: in <cb n="EXST" /> mare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 2, 6, § 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17252.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17252.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:214" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 16, 53, § 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 194" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 194</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam in tyranni os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 23, 23, § 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17252.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cast out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mare (te) conceptum spumantibus exspuit undis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum vivum optime purgat aurum, ceteras ejus sordes exspuens crebro jactatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 32, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 36, 60, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carbonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in litus purgamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 98, 101, § 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrumam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17252.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to expel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseriam ex animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem ex animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1041" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1041</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exstantia: <entryFree id="n17253" type="main" key="exstanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exstantĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ext-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exsto</etym>, <sense id="n17253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prominence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projection</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exstasis: <entryFree id="n17254" type="main" key="exsta^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exstăsis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ext-</orth>), <case>acc.</case> in; <case>abl.</case> <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/kstasis</foreign>, <sense id="n17254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amazement</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 3, 10</bibl> (= stupor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 5, 26</bibl>); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 30</bibl>, tit.</sense></entryFree>
exsterno: <entryFree id="n17255" type="main" key="exsterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-sterno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ext-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sterno, ĕre; formed acc. to the analogy of consterno, āre</etym>, <sense id="n17255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive beside one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to terrify greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affright</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem assiduis luctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsternata malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 64, 165</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 641</bibl> (corresp. to exterrita); 11, 77; <cit><quote lang="la">id. lb. 432: animos nostros perinde laetitia et dolor exsternat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Paneg. 19</bibl></cit>. (Acc. to conject. of Jacobs, also in <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 11</bibl>; and acc. to Lachm. also in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1022" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1022</bibl>, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> p. 266</bibl>.)</sense></entryFree>
exstillo: <entryFree id="n17256" type="main" key="exstillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-stillo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ext-</orth>), <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n17256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trickle out</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): amurca exstillat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinapis, oculi ut exstillent, facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrumis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exstimulator: <entryFree id="n17257" type="main" key="exsti^mu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exstĭmŭlātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ext-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exstimulo</etym>, <sense id="n17257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inciter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerrimus rebellionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verginii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exstimulo: <entryFree id="n17258" type="main" key="exsti^mu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-stĭmŭlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ext-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prick up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to goad</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). * </sense><sense id="n17258.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aculeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 37, 61, § 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17258.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to goad on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:588" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 588</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corda furore bellandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:38" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">armentum libidinis furiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigrim fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata cessantia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to hasten death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:2:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 2, 29</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstimulatur a libertis, ut ostenderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exstinctio: <entryFree id="n17259" type="main" key="exstincti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exstinctĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ext-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>exstinguo</etym>. —Prop., <sense id="n17259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting out;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">extinction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annihilation</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">supremus ille dies non exstinctionem sed commutationem affert loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 117</bibl></cit>: vitae, Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Trm. 14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Trm. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Hortens. Fragm. 90</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
exstinctor: <entryFree id="n17260" type="main" key="exstinctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-stinctor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ext-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an extinguisher</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n17260.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non exstinctor sed auctor incendii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17260.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an annihilator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroyer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne exstinctor patriae, ne proditor, ne hostis appelletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 31, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regiae domus (Cassander),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17260.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: conjurationis, <hi rend="ital">suppressor</hi> (opp. auctor et dux), Auct. Or. pro Domo, 38, 101: belli, Auct. Or. de Harusp. Resp. 23, 94.</sense></entryFree>
exstinctus: <entryFree id="n17261" type="main" key="exstinctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exstinctus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ext-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from exstinguo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17262" type="hapax" key="exstinctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exstinctus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ext-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>exstinguo</etym>, <sense id="n17262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an extinguishing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucernarum exstinctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 7, 5, § 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
exstinguibilis: <entryFree id="n17263" type="main" key="exstingui^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">exstinguĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ext-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">extinguishable;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">destructible</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 20, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epit. 36, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
exstinguo: <entryFree id="n17264" type="main" key="exstinguo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ex-stinguo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ext-</orth>), <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype> (archaic <sense id="n17264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> exstinxit, for exstinxerit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 43</bibl>.—Contracted forms exstinxsti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 682</bibl>; Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 193</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and exstinxem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 606</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to put out</hi> what is burning, <hi rend="ital">to quench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extinguish</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in Cic. and in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n17264.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">recens exstinctum lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:791" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 791</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstincta lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucernam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 3, 28, § 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">senes mori sic videntur ut sua sponte nulla adhibita vi consumptus ignis exstinguitur,</quote> <trans><tr>goes out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 19, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:712" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 712</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol exstinguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: exstincto calore ipsi exstinguimur, id. N. D. <cb n="EXST" /> 2, 9, 23: <cit><quote lang="la">calx exstincta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>slaked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17264.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of life</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite, hunc jam natura ipsa occidentem velle maturius exstingui vulnere vestro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem fortuna morbo exstinxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir egregius exstinctus,</quote> <trans><tr>cut off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 7</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">rapitur miser exstinguendus Messalinae oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:332" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel modico tepore sucus exstinguitur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is dried up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mammas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 32, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odorem alii,</quote> <trans><tr>to destroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 6, 34, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venena,</quote> <trans><tr>to render powerless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 17, 69, § 179</bibl></cit>: aquam Albanam dissipatam rivis, <hi rend="ital">to consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get rid of</hi>, an old prophecy in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 16, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17264.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to abolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annihilate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annul</hi> (syn.: tollo, deleo, opprimo, diruo, everto, demolior, destruo; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. inflammo): tyrannis institutis leges omnes exstinguuntur atque tolluntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae antea scripserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbitas exstinguenda atque delenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentiam exstinguere atque opprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc.
